reviewDescription: I had a small fan sitting on a bench to help me stay cool sleeping.  It worked great.  I bought this one thinking it would cover more area since it's bigger and osculates, and it would look better.  It does look better.  I like the remote and the noise level on the sleep setting is almost perfect (but unfortunately to get the noise just right - there's not enough air flow).  Even on high - this does not put out as much air as the smaller fan did.  Reading other reviews, maybe I don't have it situated perfectly.  I will try moving it around, but I don't have high hopes.  I threw the box away since I was sure it would be perfect and it came on cardboard recycling day.  If I still had the box, I'd return it (if it had been cheaper it would be worth keeping, putting it somewhere you didn't need as much air, but for the price, I think I could have found something that fit my needs much better).

reviewTitle: Hope you can see like a bat
reviewDescription: I like the fact you can insert the remote in the fan while it spins. Not a fan of This Fan.  Solely because you cannot 1. Find the buttons on the remote because there's no Brail.  Just a flat picee of plastic . Once the fan powers up. The remote does rework and fan spins properly. It's a challenge then to get to know the fan. Because you can't tell whether the fan is spinning on or off. Because it shuts off and on so the interface of.  The module is itself also has same issue as remote control. The face of the fan has a touch screen. However, when you go to press one of the keys, it's very convoluted in the sense that you do not know which button you are pressing and how hard to press it because the screen itself is black.  So there are no indicators as to what button you're pressing or vibrations. Anything of those matters? All in all, I give this fan. A 3 out of 5 just for the simple fact that.  It works, however, it took me a long time to set it up and was very expensive. But I do not recommend this for anybody unless they have a cat that likes to play mouse ball. This fan is just not worth it because the remote is not programmable. Unless you know you're doing with it and then.  In that sense, you don't need the remote because it's more like a novelty to have something that you can see in the dark. Thank you very much. Needs less options 😌 the programmable remote buttons make this a waste. Who needs all that!

I had to buy 2 fans since my central air unit went out last week. I read reviews of many fans and this one seemed like a real winner because of all the 5-star reviews. I did see that many gave 5 stars and still had some complaints but overall said the fan was excellent. Well, don't believe the 5-star reviews. This is a 3-star fan at best. Its cooling power is minimal at best, and the air flow is weak, very weak. I have my fan about 8 feet away from the foot of my bed and I barely feel it on the #3 setting. The features are okay but nothing that I will be using, and the remote is what is it is, a remote, nothing fancy. The best thing about this fan is that it was EASY to put together and unlike other tower fans you can actually take this apart and clean it inside and out! Overall, for $75 I was expecting better output. I would have been better off getting a $35 pedestal fan from Walmart!

I just cleaned this fan in the shower with a pressure washer setting after having it run constantly for the last 2 months. It has been a good strong fan while it has been running. After washing the fan, it behaves erratically. It is like it has a RAT and I'm being harassed by the fan. The power can toggle the fan on or off without me touching it, as in I turn the fan off but it is plugged it and it turns itself on spontaneously. The mute display icon on the fan beeps at me spontaneously as it will light up and disappears at it's own will.

Got it back in May lasted till the beginning of August, kinda upset I spent $70 on a fan that only lasted 4 months. It’s kinda loud to be honest I have to keep it on 2 to sleep peacefully, and when it stoped working it would go from quiet to real loud and than just completely cutting off. It’s hot still outside and now I need another fan, gonna try a cheap Walmart fan cuz I got this one thinking quality over price. Apparently that wasn’t the way to go.

reviewTitle: I wish I brought a better one.
reviewDescription: It’s fine. The tower is shorter than my (big brand name) one. I didn’t think that would matter but I notice the difference in air flow where I need it every day. I wish I splurged on the better brand/model.Ease to set up and use. There are 4 fan speeds but even the highest level isn’t as powerful as my other fan.

I thought this would be an upgrade from the traditional floor model fan. Not so much. Don’t expect a blast of wind that instantly cools the room.Pros: It is quiet. Easy to assemble.I had to check twice last night to see if it was still on. Small in stature and small in power. Would not buy again.

It's quiet and easy to operate but there is NO WAY the air flow is 25 feet.  We have this in our living room to help move the a/c air and I barely feel it on setting 4 about 7-8 feet away.It's so hard to find a powerful tower fan.  Maybe they don't exist.

Product didn't turn on. I tried different outlets, checked the fuse and nothing. Called customer support for help and they were kind and helpful.  Finally told me to return it and I just started the process.  I'm not sure if I'll buy another one since there are a couple of reviews like mine.

This is NOT that quiet! There have to be other “quiet” fans out there than this! I came to bed, laid down and asked my husband why this fan is louder than the one we just got rid of for this one. Ugh. He had it on high and it was a constant humming/machine noise. I know I’m picky and like quiet, quiet when I sleep, so that could be part of it. For those that like “white noise” or “something’s running” noises to sleep, you’ll probably be OK. I’ll probably return it once I find another QUIETER fan for him.

Bought this fan just over a month ago and stopped working completely this morning It will not power on and I have tried it in multiple different outlets. Tried to consult the user manual and their support and got no help. We've used the fan regularly and it hardly ever moved and was working completely fine last night. It seems like loose wiring but there is no way to access that inside the center of the fan. This terrible design has basically made it totally worthless in just over 30 days.

I put it on the highest setting , level 4 and it is very weak. Not sure if this is how its supposed to be or mine was a defect because I can't understand why do there are high reviews for thos product. I literally have to sit right in front of it to fedl anything. There is no way this is going to cool a small room. It has 4 speeds but ileven the highest level did not work.

reviewTitle: The fan died the 2nd day of use - WARNING
reviewDescription: This fan died the 2nd day of use. It is not quiet. It is louder than well made circular fan. I am very dissapointed.Background: It arrived perfectly wrapped. No dents in the box. No damage to the box. The remote is functional and the back and forth cycling all still work. The motor that drives fan itself that moves the air is dead.  It's a worthless piece of plastic now.Waste of money.

I’ve purchased two of these in the past year. One for my daughter to take to college and one for my home. Hers is quiet and so relaxing. The one for me is very loud too loud to even use. It sounds like a motor. Contacted immediately and company wouldn’t send out a replacement. The box was damaged so likely this was damaged during shipping which is no fault of the customer.

I don’t know how to feel about this fan. I read the reviews when I first got it and thought I would enjoy it, but upon receiving it I’m kind of disappointed. I’m a person who gets very hot all the time so I needed something in my room that’ll keep me cool. I put the fan in the corner of my bedroom and I couldn’t feel anything so I decided to move it close to me and it’s the strangest thing. When I’m directly in front of it I can feel the air, but if I step back a few inches I can’t feel anything. I don’t know if mine is defective or that’s just how it works.

reviewTitle: Died after 2 years of use in the summer
reviewDescription: We bought this in May 2022.  We replaced another 2.5 AMP in the plug thinking the amp died.  It's not working at all.  The power button is not working.  Completely dead.  Wasted all that money. Sure this ripped us off.  We thought this will last at least 5 years.  Only used for the last three summers, except this summer cut short. We didn't use all seasons.  We will not buy anything from Dreo.Disappointed.

reviewTitle: Sticking with the cheap box fan
reviewDescription: I wanted to like this fan more but I didn’t. The airflow is about 1/2 of what a cheap box fan does and quiet mode did not make a difference. The first night we had it, we had it going while we slept. All of the sudden it started with the whining and squealing noises when it was rotating. Item lasted not even one full day before it started to break. I returned it and I’m sticking with the cheap box fan.

reviewTitle: don't know what everyone is raving about
reviewDescription: disappointed in reading others reviews and so I purchased this fan for my bedroom.the fan power isn't that great but why I need to return it is because my bedroom fan I was replacing after many years of use, was tall.  I have a tall bed, so I was able to feel the air when laying down on my bed.  well this fan I can't feel hardly anything and that is because this fan is short! top of fan is 4 inches above my bed so all the air blows and hits side of bed.  so if you have  a raised bed this fan won't work.

Kinda like when you say this vacuum sucks. But means a good thing. Well wish I could say this fan really blows and mean a good thing. BUT I don't . It is not quite as stated. It's barely blows and that's on high. I'm really disappointed because on line a review said it's like a Dyson without the price tag.

Probably the biggest reason to buy a fan is how well that it cools you.  On its highest speed (4), it moves about as much air as my Lasko does on speed (2).  It’s speed (3) is equivalent to my Lasko’s speed (1).  This fan’s quietness comes from its lack of power.  Speed (1) is a joke, speed (2) moves a little air.Its cord is about 2 feet shorter than my Lasko.  Length matters.It’s not bad to look at, but at the end of the day, I expect my fan to move air, which this fan doesn’t do well.

I use ratings to buy things I’m not familiar with, and reviewers - you did not disappoint! This fan is set at 2, goes up to 4; and I can feel the breeze from at least 10 ft away. Its motor is very quiet. It has a timer, and sleep mode where the lit display center is off - unlike many that simply have lower illumination and still keep me up. I haven’t used all the features yet, otherwise maybe I’d give it 5 stars. It was easy to assemble. I’m pleased with the oscillating feature. Overall, this is a high quality fan for a fair price. It works better than expected. I highly recommend this fan. Its sleek design is appealing to the eye. I am very pleased with this purchase.

reviewTitle: Fine, but some baffling design choices
reviewDescription: Not a bad fan — I’ve only had it a few days but it seems to work alright, it’s pretty powerful, easy to assemble and seems straightforward to clean down the line. But for some reason, even though there’s a screen, it automatically shuts off after a few minutes, and there’s no way to make it stay on. So if you have it in low, you could leave your home and not realize you left it on the whole time. Strangely, the screen *does* stay on during Sleep mode (???). The modes themselves are a little confusing compared to every other fan I’ve ever used — not sure why more than two are needed (regular and sleep). So, it’ll do the job but prepare to be very mildly frustrated from time to time

reviewTitle: Overhyped but good for what it is.
reviewDescription: The good. 4 settings with a remote so you don't need to get up to adjust it. It oscillates if you want it to. The air travels far on the 4th setting. Although people saying it's quiet mean it's quiet on setting 1. It otherwise is louder than a box fan. Takes up a little less space than a box fan although it can't be put into a window like a box fan. It's also 5x or more expensive than a cheap box fan.The bad. The air it pushes out goes to a very slim area which based on the design makes sense. This however means you need to have this pointed perfectly where you want the air to flow. It is also very loud if it's set on higher settings. The stand/base feels very flimsy. It's held up so far but the "Locking" mechanism is non-existent. You turn this thing slightly, and it will come off the base. The gap for the chord to stick out is really bad. Moving this pretty much guarantees it will sit on the chord pinching it with all of its weight.Overall - I wish I didn't buy this one. There were similar models of this on a different website cheaper by up to 20 dollars but honestly I could have lived without this. The box fan I was using did the trick, and cost significantly less. It is what it is though. We pay for premium, and this technically does what I need it to.

reviewTitle: Great fan, with one small exception
reviewDescription: This is a very nice tower fan.  It's quiet and the 90 degree oscillation is a plus for rooms where the a/c doesn't quite reach.  The downside for me is honestly the remote.  The genius that designed the remote was going for that 'sleek' look and made the buttons the same colour as the rest of the remote, so in low light, it's impossible to see the buttons themselves.  You need to memorize the layout of the remote so you don't press the wrong button, which is annoying at times.  Having the ability to mute the sounds is wonderful though.So far, I am pleased with this purchase and would recommend.

I like this. I live in a small home with A/C and ceiling fans so this fits my needs. It doesn't take up a lot of space, it is pretty quiet, it moves enough air around that I am more comfortable leaving my A/C on a higher setting, it looks nice, and seems to have good functionality.Could it be a bit stronger? Yeah, I would love at least one higher fan speed. This fan doesn't even get air into my kitchen that is open to the living room (total house is <700 sq ft) but it does makes a difference in the one room that could use a serious ceiling fan upgrade. To be HONEST, if you do not have A/C and/or ceiling fans, if you are really depending on a floor fan to keep you cool, then you will be better off with one of those noisy, turbo box fans. You probably won't be happy with this. If you are enhancing existing air temp mgmt then it may be just the bit of extra you need.I also love that they gave consideration to cleaning. I have windows open 3 out of 4 seasons and I can't count the hours I have spent with a toothbrush trying to clean box fans that look horrible. That counts for a lot.Update:Still very pleased with this fan.  It is really saving me AC $s in conjunction with my ceiling fan. And it is almost completely quiet until you get to speed 4 (and not what I would call noisy even then).Also, 90 deg oscillation is a lot in a small room so I tend to leave it off. Get more constant breeze that way. The natural setting option is kind of neat, also, but it’s been so hot this summer I have wanted it full on always.As regards a couple comments I read about the remote:1. Yes there is a storage slot for the remote in back of the unit.2. The remote and/or the unit sort of go to sleep so don’t be surprised that you have to click a couple times to change fan speed, set timer, etc. It does make it feel a bit clunky but probably saves energy/battery.

reviewTitle: This Item is Defective. Edit: My mistake. Good fan.
reviewDescription: I paid plenty for this item and it's totally defective! It doesn't stand up making it useless! Unfortunately, I ran out of time to return it or to let the sellers know. The fan cannot stand up. It doesn't even wobble standing, it literally cannot remain upright at all. It's so unfortunate that it's too late to do anything about it. I am very disappointed.EDIT: I discovered a missing piece after digging in the box and realized it comes with a stand. Now I feel silly. I assembled it with the stand, plugged it in and used the remote control. It works just fine, lots of air and it's quiet. Thumbs up!

reviewTitle: Not as quiet after a month of use
reviewDescription: Had this fan for a little over a month, I’ve used it almost every day and it’s no longer as quiet as it was. There is a constant buzzing when it first turns on now for the first 5 minutes or so. The fan itself is great, the oscillation is wonderful, the strength of the fan is perfect for smaller rooms. It’s super lightweight which makes it easy to switch rooms, I just wish it had stayed as quiet as it originally was.

This is a nice fan. It looks sleek and the oscillation works well. It's also not terribly loud like some others. The only thing I would change is to make it a bit taller. It's so short that it's hard to use while sleeping if yo want a fan blowing directly on you. There's also no way to adjust the vents to point up or down. The touch controls are nice, and have a variety of settings.

reviewTitle: Fan works well, remote could be better
reviewDescription: This fan is very powerful and I like that it has a quiet mode (no beeps) for night time. It keeps me nice and cool at night and have been comfortable at night in my room with no A/C here in California during summer. I wish that the remote lit up when you touched it because controlling the fan at night with the remote is very difficult unless I use the light from my phone.

reviewTitle: Liked  almost everything, but not all
reviewDescription: The base is sturdy and doesn't wobbleAir flow is pretty goodNot too hard to assembleI don't like that the Led display goes offSometimes you may want to look and see what speed it is on, and you have to find the remoteCan't imagine that little light keeping anyone up at nightShould be an option to leave it on or off, or it should stay on
I was disappointed when the fan arrived. The rotation is so slow and force of air not strong.

reviewTitle: Meh.  A narrow stream of air and when oscillating a waste. My box fan is better.
reviewDescription: Meh.  A narrow stream of air and when oscillating a waste. My box fan is better.
Me esperaba q fuera potente, muy lindo y grande pero nada q ver con la ventilación.
I never bought a standing fan like this or tower fan ever. So this is my first time trying it, but it don’t work right it’s weird to me too many functions and I just don’t like it.

reviewTitle: 2 stars because it’s nice if you’re right in front of it
reviewDescription: Air is not cool or strong. Super disappointed. Definitely no reach. Maybe 3 ft.
Worked great for a couple weeks….. then… well….
I don’t know if I received a defective fan but it stopped working after a month, I really liked it in the beginning but sad it didn’t last.
It’s not as quiet as I had hoped it would be.

reviewTitle: High pitched whine from fan motor
reviewDescription: Used it for about two hours when then motor developed a high pitched "whine".  Not sure what is making the noise, but it's NOT quiet.
This thing is out of balance and loud. Definitely not a quality item. It does blow air though. I don’t see it lasting very long.
I just purchased the fan, it worked for one night and haven’t worked since. Don’t waste your money!
Absolute garbage. It’s so noisy
The wind volume was to low, couldn’t feel the fan.  Didn’t help keep the heat down.
No sirve para nada

This crappy fan stopped working less than a month ear since it’s been on. It’s been switching back and fourth with a mind of its own. Turns on and off when it wants. Now doesn’t work at all. Piece of crap. The touch face doesn’t work, nor does the remote.
Doesn’t not blow cold as it says it does and stopped working after a few days

I got this after reading all the reviews saying how great of an air conditioner it was. It is NOT an air conditioner more like a fan. I’m not one to write reviews but I feel like I needed to do that anyone else looking into it is aware.

reviewTitle: Worked great for 6 maybe 8 months now makes a lot of noise!
reviewDescription: Worked great for a while I use it for at night because I use wood to heat my house and some nights it gets hot so all summer and winter it runs and last night it started to make a lot of noise so I cleaned it and now it makes even more noise and the barring in the motor is what’s making the noise and it’s about to brake plus the remote just one day didn’t work for it with in the first week!!

reviewTitle: Quit working second day I had it on
reviewDescription: I threw away box ,so wasn't able to return it. Bummer I really needed this, but no help from manufacturing as I didn't have box any more. What a waste of money

reviewTitle: Low frequency noise, if you are a light sleeper or suffer from insomnia read this review.
reviewDescription: The good: This fan really cranks out the cool air even on 1 of 4, I tend to leave it on 2 where I currently live that gets well into the 90s sometimes higher during summer.The bad: It sporadically makes a low frequency sound on a 1-2 out of ten. Laying in a quiet bedroom trying to fall asleep then all of a sudden hearing this low ringing/electricity flowing type sound is terrible. It appears to go up in sound the higher you turn up the cool air circulation on it so not even the fan drowns it out.I bought this hoping to stay cool and drown out some early morning noise due to where I live, it does that... Managing I can stay asleep and not have my ear catch the eeeeeeeee sound like a faucet dripping non stop your brain catches to.I have insomnia, this fan only makes it more difficult to sleep.

reviewTitle: I should have bought a box fan
reviewDescription: Very poor air circulation on highest level, which is 4.  I kept going back to check it not believing it was working properly but it was.  I just realized... it got to be a joke, right?  No, it stinks for air and THAT IS WHY I BOUGHT IT, FOR AIR!!!!  Omg, don't bother with this, awful.
Not happy at all, in the middle of a heat weave right now my Costco fan stopped osculating I bought this and it doesn't have half the power. I'm going to be returning this fan asap.
This fan is just that…a fan. It is nothing like an A/C as people have advertised on different platforms. It does not cooldown a room or anything. I can’t believe I wasted my money on this!

It as 4 speed and the 4th speed barely pushes anything. You hs stop stand directly next to it for you to feel anything. Definitely not worth the purchase. I’m disappointed. If I could give a Zero start I would.  Bough it for my bed room and there is barely anything breeze coming from it!

reviewTitle: It's like a fan and not a cooling unit
reviewDescription: It doesn't really cool any area or room
You can’t feel air coming out very weak

reviewTitle: Used for the first time and didnt work
reviewDescription: Assembled the fan as instructed and the fan didn't even work. No air was blowing out the fan it just oscillated and that's it. Would not recommend product was new but it doesn't work.

Unfortunately I am very disappointed. Yes it’s quiet and fits in good places but it doesn’t cool anything down. I’ve had it in my room and my room isn’t big at all and I was hoping it would cool it down especially with summer here but it didn’t. Definitely not worth the money.
Not really strong fan or cooling
Can’t use it , it’s cracked.
It does the job. Nothing spectacular. It’s okay for the price
Good

reviewTitle: Good fan, but wish it was taller
reviewDescription: Overall this is a nice fan.  It generates the standard amount of air flow found in tower fans and isn't overly noisy or disruptive.  It's lights turn off completely so it does not disrupt sleep at night.  Like any other fan, it does gather dust but this fan can be taken apart fairly easily (2 screws) and cleaned.  The one criticism I have is the height of the fan: I wish it was about 6 inches taller so that airflow reached over the top of my bed.

So I bought this fan last week and it got delivered earlier this week but I just put it together today. It's easy to put together. Snap the bottom ring together then twist on bottom of fan. There are 4 speeds with 4 being the highest. It seems decent but not super sonic air. Probably should have upgraded but it should be fine. It's very nice and sleek and hopefully lasts a few years. It's not as loud as a box fan. It does produce noise for the white noise lovers.

This is a bedroom/bathroom fan. Very pleased with its performance and power. The noise level is just right for sleeping. My only complaint would be the inability to raise the body of the fan. Would prefer it to higher so more air would circulate the middle of the room and not so much the floor level.

I was worried that this fan would be “cheap” but it is great. Originally purchased during a heat wave when AC went out so that I would have some air movement while waiting 5 days to get the AC repaired. The multiple wind strengths are great and it’s not too loud to sleep with. I don’t normally listen to anything while sleeping and did not find the sound bothersome at all. Now using regularly to keep costs down and has continued to work great.

reviewTitle: gets the job done, but not perfect
reviewDescription: this fan is pretty okay. it doesn't get super cool and the rotation is very broad. there is nowhere on the fan to store the remote which is strange as most fans i've purchased with remotes have a built in feature for the remote to sit when it isn't in use. it is helping to cool my 80 degree apartment a bit, but it would be better if it was a bit stronger

reviewTitle: Good for a smaller room and enough to keep you chilled out for the Summer
reviewDescription: I weirdly expected this to be bigger than it is. I will say there is no way to control where the blades aim, it's just as is. So if you wanted the air to go higher or lower or aim somewhere, you cannot. I will say, I feel like the air could be colder but it is good enough to keep a small room cold. I just wish it was bigger and blew more powerful air.

It’s very very quiet and I sleep very well with its virtually silent hum, however, I was expecting more powerful and robust air movement. Perfect for a small office or dorm room but I need a little something extra for my larger bedroom. I would buy it again though. 😂

reviewTitle: It doesn’t make your room colder
reviewDescription: It doesn’t make your room colder, but it does blow fast air, which does help cool you off a bit. I like it because it is pretty quiet and doesn’t take up too much room and has a bunch of different settings you can use. Also, really easy to install.

The fan operates quietly at low speeds but becomes noisier as the speed increases. It's powerful enough to eliminate the need for an air conditioner. I prefer using the fan because, unlike an AC, it provides immediate cooling without waiting for the entire house to cool down. The remote control is surprisingly convenient and more useful than I anticipated. Overall, it was a good purchase, especially given how hot it has been lately.

Fan works fine. Quiet enough for me. The problem is the remote. You have to be dead on straight or it won’t work. With nothing between the remote and the fan, if you are off even a few degrees from straight on,  it’s not gonna work. Fan is 5 stars. Remote is 1.

First, I like that it’s silent. That goes a long way with me, considering that my other fan sounds like it’s going through a war zone. The power level is okay, but nothing to write home about. It’s light, and relatively small, but I wish it were a little bigger for more power/fan area. Easy to use, simple.

I love this fan. very quiet. I just realized it filters the air it expels. It's easy to clean and at the volume it produces, the filter is definitely a positive feature. This is a 5 star purchase, I don't read 5 star ratings and do not write them. People be crazy. You will like this fan.

This fan is much quieter than the box fans we have been using.  Much more affordable than a Dyson, but you can hear it, unlike the Dyson.  The fan can be felt across the full living room from the dining room.  We are very satisfied with the product, especially for the price.

There is a few things I would change if I could and that would be for it to make more noise and blow a little harder. All in all this fan has been great. This fan blows super cold air out and I feel like it makes a big difference in our room.

Funciona tal cual la descripción, como mejora, recomendaría que el ventilador  lo puedas direccionar hacia arriba o acha abajo, a veces uno quiere que la brisa llegue por lo menos al pecho pero no, solo te funcionará si estas acostado o sentado, más o menos a la altura de la cintura.

I live in Texas and this fan has helped cool my house during the summer time tremendously!!!I love that I can control with the remote or the app via wifi (because i'm lazy)I used this fan every day all summer long on highest power, unplugged and set aside for the winter, then went to plug it back in about a week ago to get ready for warmer weather and it didn't turn on at all (why I gave 4 stars)I contacted customer service for the item and after providing them a short video and explanation of the problem, they provided me with a completely FREE REPLACEMENT that I received within 7 days!! I would also like to note that I did NOT choose to pay extra for warranty on the original item, but the company provides a manufacturer's warranty anyway for the first year. It was 2 1/2 months until my one-year standard warranty was over, and I still had no problem getting it replaced for no charge.I spoke with "Mia" and she was very helpful the entire time. I'm so grateful for their attention and understanding to their customers, as well as the timely replies from customer service and replacement shipping!Would definitely recommend this company!

When it comes to size, this fan is perfect. When it comes to function, it does its job of providing coolness. When oscillating at the highest mode you do feel the cool air, with not much noise. The control feature on the fan is easy to understand and use. It’s light weight and can be moved around easily.

It was easy to put together and light weight to carry around from room to room if needed. The remote control comes ready to go. The wind speeds feel nice. The noise is quiet like white noise. Only bad or good for me is that I have to have it far away to get the full effect of the “tower fan”. I was using it in my office close to me but it never cooled off the top of me due to being so close so plug it in farther from you.

It’s a cute fan but, I feel like for $60+ the air should be colder. I use this in my salon, unfortunately they don’t always have the air on. I move a lot and I feel like I shouldn’t be using the Dreo and an oscillating fan to stay somewhat cool. 2 Dreo’s may be better but I rather not spend another $60+.

reviewTitle: It’s ok, not sure is worth the extra 💵
reviewDescription: Bought this over the other options that are very similar, not sure it’s worth the extra $$ just because it’s a Dreo.  Just my opinion.
It's only good for circulating the warm air that's it.

reviewTitle: Looks nice but doesn’t blow air well
reviewDescription: I bought this fan for my work out room. It looks nice and sleek but really doesn’t blow air like I was hoping for at full power. My treadmill is only about 4’ away and I can barely feel it. Definitely not what I was hoping for.

reviewTitle: Not as powerful as advertised, I'm a bit disappointed.
reviewDescription: it does not throw out the air like a mini one I just bought...paid 1/4 the price, it's sleek and pretty, but can I return this?
Would not buy again, can barely feel the air, makes no difference. Even on 4, you can barely feel it. Not worth the buy.
After only a couple days of using this fan?m, it started to make an ear-piercing sound that continued to get worse and worse.
Quiet and its just a fan. Nothing special

When I turn it on, it blows normal for a few seconds then sounds like it’s blowing super hard then it completely stops for a second. This constantly repeats. It’s pretty annoying to hear and distracting when I’m trying to sleep.
The reach of the fan is not what I expected. If you're 6 ft away you can't feel it anymore.

I had high hopes for this fan. It worked beautifully for 2 months and now the blower goes in and out, not wanting to work consistently. Of course it’s just outside the return window. High price too pay for something that quits working in two months

reviewTitle: Buy a different brand- no good
reviewDescription: Unless you are sitting right underneath it, it does not work all that good, it doesn’t cool a room, the look is cool, the price, but you better off getting an AC, this was no good, I will return it for something else. Save you money!

I’m not sure what the reviews are all about but it does not blow any cool air and if anything my Honeywell fan works way better!!! This product feels like a scam and I should have known better when I seen it on the TikTok shop aka I’ll advertise so I can get paid for the review type of vibe smh going back!!
Really liked the fan but unfortunately, it stopped blowing air after 1 month.

reviewTitle: Good fan, poor design. Will not buy again.
reviewDescription: I've had this fan for 3 weeks. The fan works great, remote is nice however when I picked it up to move to vacuum today the bottm Feet snapped off. At this point the fan is junk. It wont function as oscillating.
Not worth it. The highest is a 4 doesn’t blow cold air so on a really hot day it won’t do much. I only bought it for my room. You can’t even feel it only of you stand right next to it.
I read the other reviews on how this works wonders. It does not it barely even cools my room. I feel no cool air coming out of it. I would return it but its too late for me to return it now.
After having it and using it for about 3 weeks now, I can report that mine has developed this sporadic screechy squeak as it runs, oscillating and not. Really annoying
This fan is too short, too slow, too weak. I have no idea where these good reviews are coming from. My cheap window fan is better than this. Save your money and just get a window AC. This sucks.

reviewTitle: Spits out dust when you turn it on
reviewDescription: This fan is a joke. I purchased two and the black one seems to work if you sit right in front of it. The white one spits dust every time you turn it on max speed. I vacuum them and it still does it. Stick with Lasko for better cooling for your buck. I'm so mad at myself for wasting money!

I was thrilled to find my fan this evening when I returned home from my office today.I was practically bouncing with glee as I ripped open the packaging and assembled my new air mover... a prince of fans if you will.He was beautiful, matte black, sleek, a fancy little remote for his pleasure. Glorious! The renowned airlifting champ.Then I plugged him in, ready to rotate some air.Level 2. Eh, weak for my tastes, like an iced tea with no ice. So I crank it to 3. A little better, but I can only feel him when I'm within two feet, and I like my personal space. He's a bit clingy. Not my type but we give it a go. Up to 4.4 is still weak, he's not winning any airlifting contests. I step further back. One. Two. Three steps. I no longer feel his breath on my skin. And I can't help it. I'm disappointed.I expected more from my renowned airlifting champ.He's being returned to the land of Fanning. Tomorrow.It's a one night fan. A disappointing one, one I'd coyote my arm off to get away from.  Pretty. But useless.

In the midst of a major heat wave, I was desperate for relief.  I reviewed a number of tower fans and ultimately chose this one.  Big mistake.  The cooling is minimal at best; the controls are not user friendly.  My two older tower fans work much more efficiently and with greater ease.  I cannot recommend this product.

Do not purchase this product. This is the worst product I’ve ever purchased. It came broken in the parts. Don’t even match. Spent an hour trying to make this work and didn’t and then you have to deal with the whole hassle, returning it. Absolutely a disaster. Do not buy this product at all stay away away buyers be aware.

reviewTitle: Piece of trash.Worked for a little while. Return is a HUGE PAIN
reviewDescription: Worked for a short time. Frustrating. Instructional book has pages of tips to get it to work if it doesn't. ??? Not sure why I bought another mechanical item as USED. 🙄 So if all of that doesn't work, then find a tall box to put it in to return. All for $35.00.  NOPE! I want a refund. I'll be happy to drop it off at UPS as is without a box like 95% of Amazon products. I buy tons from Amazon but never again from this company. It's going in the trash where it belongs. I'm hot. I still need a fan.

reviewTitle: Producto disponible para venta a Chile, pero completamente incompatible
reviewDescription: Este producto está calificado como disponible en Chile. Se pagan impuestos de internación y envío, que no son bajos. Sin embargo, la compatibilidad de sus componentes y estandar eléctrico es incompatible con la normativa chilena, por lo que encendí el dispositivo y duró 5 minutos antes de quemarse y quedar completamente inutilizable. El servicio técnico de la marca me indicó que la responsabilidad es de Amazon por vender este producto a usuarios que no tienen condiciones para que funcione correctamente, que inclusive con un transformador de corriente el desenlace hubiese sido el mismo. Perdí dinero y gané una mala experiencia de compra.

Esthetically pleasing. But for the price could buy 4 box fans which are MUCH more effective, just not as sleek. Does NOT cool a room. Weak airflow. Can’t feel air from the end of a bed on highest setting. Genuinely. If your room/apt/home (even if small) is hot, it won’t cool it down. But it’s a nice looking fan.
The picture gives off the impression of it cooling a room really well, but in reality it barely even works sometimes. And when it does barely any good and cool air comes out.

reviewTitle: Less than 2 months later fan is already making a horrible whining noise.
reviewDescription: It has been less than 2 months since buying this fan and it is making a terrible whining noise.

THE POWER OF THIS TOWER FAN IS HORRIBLE. I CALLED CUSTOMER SERVICE, AND THEY GAVE ME OPTIONS TO RETURN AND GET A REFUND, BUT I HAVE BEEN THROUGH THIS TOO MANY TIMES THAT I AM GIVING UP. AND FROM READING THE OTHER REVIEW, I ESPECIALLY DO NOT NEED 3 FANS. I WILL NEVER BUY FROM THIS COMPANY AGAIN. I WILL STICK TO LASKO. IT'S NOISY BUT POWERFUL THAN THIS TOWER FAN.

reviewTitle: Good fan but with quality control issues.
reviewDescription: I was excited to unbox this fan and try it, and the main reason why I chose this fan was the marketed low noise. It’s a great fan but I may have gotten a dud, there’s an annoying whining/ringing sound whenever the fans on which defeats the purpose of “silent.”

I love everything about this fan, it's not loud, it actually blows cool air, it swivels and has a remote for convenience. There are several speeds and you can keep it in one direction if you want. It is such a versatile fan and works amazing. Absolutely worth the money😊

So far, I am impressed with this smaller tower fan. It fits well in the small bedroom. Looks great and it functions well.  Blends in the background and is hardly noticeable. Easy to put together and has many options to choose to distribute airflow. Power 1 and 2 are so quiet that you won't realize the fan is on. Power 3 & 4 are a bit louder, but nothing that is going to bother you with the noise. Really enjoy the "Natural" setting as it makes for a natural breeze with various air speeds in this setting. The remote is very useful, too. Can store it in the fan itself. The fan also is a breeze to carry around and place it where it's needed most. All and all, this is a wonderful fan for a smaller space to cool down. I liked it so much, that I bought another one in the silver/black color. Definitely recommend Dreo Nomad Bedroom Fan.

reviewTitle: Of any fan this has best user experience in features
reviewDescription: The fan blows air well, and it's quiet.  But this thing is truly a pleasing experience to use.  The control features of this are engineered like Steve Jobs might have - give them the features they don't yet know they want. I was surprised by several modes and behaviors of this that I never knew would be helpful on a fan. Some examples- When you turn it on it goes to higher speed for a second and then to whatever level you had it set to before. This lets you know that you actually turned it on successfully when it might not make a sound at a low speed level. The white LED lighted controls automatically turn off after a few seconds.  The remote has a really nice modern, sleep button design and feel.  The remote and sensor are so powerful that the fan can be pointed away from you and it still responds to the remote. You can turn the button press beeps off! And of course it's really quiet and oscillates as designed.

This tower fan was easy to set up (less than 2 minutes) and it was up and running.  It is very quiet and powerful. Great features that I have not used yet but can't wait to use for better sleep.  The remote is easy to use and handy if you get too cool. Only feature I wish it had, is a temperature display. I will update this post, if needed.

This fan looks really good in our living room, it helps fill in free space. Its easy to move around and the cord is long. The buttons are easy to press as well. It rotates fantastically, there is no squeaking so it turns well. Great for the price!

i’ve had this fan for ~4 months & have had no issues with it. i leave it running nearly 24/7 & it still works as if brand new. it’s sturdy, the buttons are easy to press for adjusting, & at the highest level it’s pretty powerful. it’s very quiet on the lower levels & at the higher levels it still has the white noise factor but it’s a way softer sound than a box fan & doesn’t rattle at all. id recommend this fan & if i ever needed another fan for another room i would buy this one.

I've had a classic bladed fan for a long time, it started shaking so I figured I would replace it before it crapped out on me. This thing came up on social media somewhere and I figured why not, looked it up and purchased it. I've had it for a few months now, bought back in May. It's a life saver. It's not magic, it's not going to cool the room, but it's powerful so it blows cold air. If you need a loud fan though, this isn't the one for you. It's not silent but it's not as loud as a traditional fan. It has a noise function but on mine it seems to be a useless button, I'm not sure what it's supposed to do.

Dreo vs Lasko Tower Fans--Which Should You Buy?Summer is coming, and everyone could use a little more cooling on hot summer days. Gone are the days of box fans or awkward top heavy circular oscillating fans. Today, when people need a little extra air flow, they go for a tower fan with a remote.As you might expect, there is a dizzying array of choices available. In this article, we’ll compare the Lasko 2511 with a new option on the market, the Dreo. 36” tower fan. Both of these fans offer a quality experience, but which should you buy?Air FlowAs you would expect, fan speed, or more specifically, the wind speed of the air leaving the fan, is probably the most important consideration when selecting one. You want something that will move air! Both the Lasko and Dreo tower fans offer multiple speeds to customize your cooling comfort.The Lasko has three speeds, the lowest bing really gentle, with the highest being significant enough to be felt 8 feet away. The Dreo, on the other hand, has four speeds available. 1, 2, and 3 are pretty comparable to the feel of the Lasko. However, speed 4 is noticeably more powerful than what the Lasko offers.It’s also worth mentioning that the Lasko oscillates over a 45° spread, while the Dreo has a 90° oscillation. So overall, the Dreo is going to move air over a larger area, but ultimately it seems like this difference is going to come down to a matter of preference.NoiseThe noise level of both fans is pretty comparable, with the Dreo being noticeably quieter at lower speeds. From three feet away, at speed 1, the Dreo registers at a whisper quiet 34 dB, while the Lasko is 44 dB. You have to get the Dreo up to speed 3 to hit 44 dB, and at that speed, the Lasko only goes up to 47 dB. Basically ,the Lasko doesn’t add much more noise at the different speeds.The Dreo does have that extra speed 4 that cranks up the noise a bit with the wind speed. At speed 4, the Dreo runs at 48 dB.The Dreo has an extra feature that Lasko is lacking. You can mute the button sounds. This is handy if you want to make adjustments without interrupting the quiet.DesignThe design of these two fans is similar, but also so markedly different that it’s hard not to remark on it.Lasko, as with many of their products, has opted for a functional, utilitarian design that gets the job done. It doesn’t look particularly bad, but it’s not great either. The light indicators let you know what your settings are, but they're just dots of lights next to numbers. In the case of the sleep timer, they even require you to do math to know what the timer is set on. And the numbers you’re looking at are printed on the fan, not backlit. So you’re going to have to turn on the light to check your settings if you’re in a dark room.The Dreo, on the other hand, looks like a work of modern art, with its all black design, and the big LED screen. You won’t have any problem knowing what speed the fan is set to or what the sleep timer is set on. No moving closer to inspect tiny numbers printed on the casing.The design differences carry through to the remotes. The Lasko remote is functional, if unsightly, while the Dreo is beautiful and sleek (and the Dreo remote also comes with a battery; the Lasko doesn’t).Ease of UseTo be honest, any fan is pretty dead simple to use, but some are easier than others.In the case of these two, the Lasko comes with fairly simple instructions: push the power button to turn on, adjust the speed, etc.The Dreo has similarly simple instructions, but also has some additional options (mute, auto mode, natural mode, etc.).Also, the Dreo instructions are delivered in a much more appealing and professionally polished package, which I can’t ignore. Providing an instruction booklet like this sends a message to your customers that you take their experience seriously.One feature of the Dreo that isn’t included in the instructions is the easy to remove and clean back panel. If you’ve ever run a fan for any amount of time, you know that you’ll be dealing with dust buildup. With the one screw panel removal, the Dreo makes that much simpler. The back panel on the Lasko looks like you’ll have to remove six screws, but I’m not sure if it’s really designed to remove and clean.ConclusionChoosing from a wide selection of very similar products can be daunting at the best of times. For something like a tower fan, there’s really just not that much to the hardware to differentiate one from the other, but Dreo does manage to bring a more compelling product to the market. With quieter operation, a large and bright LED display, more features, a more appealing design, and a better user experience, the Dreo 36” tower fan really does offer a better product than the Lasko 2511. And you’ll pay $10 more for that difference, as the Lasko only costs 59.99, while the Dreo retails for 69.99. Whether or not the upgrades are worth the extra expense is really up to you, but for a product that will last for years to come, my money is on Dreo.

I use this almost every night I go to sleep. I now stay in Southern California where heat is no stranger to those that already reside here, except me, cause I’m not from here. So in order to keep from melting I turn this thing on as a nightly ritual. First, it doesn’t get as cool as the picture would have you to believe it does. I looked at the picture and saw “little portable AC cold” but really it’s just a cylindrical fan that gets cool enough to remind you of a late night breeze. You can control how intense you want it to be though and it can get a bit strong. It’s fairly easy to use with an oscillation button, a timer of how long you would like it to be on for, and it comes with a remote, which I keep right next to my pillow. There’s even a setting for the air flow or how you want the air to blow out.  From the floor it’s probably slightly taller than a toddler but very light weight,  and easy to move. I would certainly recommend for those looking to escape excessive heat.

I purchased three Dyson Tower Fans in 2018 and used them in my bedroom, computer room and front room.  I then purchased a fourth Dyson Tower Fan for use in my dining room/kitchen in 2022.  I have been extremely happy with the Dyson fans, but this month when one of the fans I bought in 2018 started making a high whining noise, I decided to replace it.  I, of course, being very satisfied with the Dyson fans, checked out the pricing on Amazon and found that the price had increased by over $200 from when I bought them in 2018.I therefore decided to check out other tower fans and was impressed with the Dreco Tower Fan's price, style and customer reviews so I ordered one.  I received it on 7-23-24 and have been VERY impressed with the fan.  It is extremely quiet on the 1 and 2 speeds, and even on 1 provides so much air that I have never had to increase the speed, and that is saying something with the HOT July weather western Washington has faced this year.  Since August is expected to be just as hot, I know I am really going to enjoy this fan.  And perhaps best of all, the price was over $200 less than I would have had to pay for a new Dyson, which for an elderly person on fixed income, is especially appreciated!.
I cant return the item otherwise I would. It broke just days after I could return it. Also it was not that strong to being with and would shut off randomly.

I searched for a fan with cooling capabilities and this came up in my results. I looked over the details on it and other fans and decided to get it. It does not cool the air and is just a fan. I should have read the description etc with a more critical eye and realized that it refers to 'cooling air' but that this is accomplished only by moving the air. I have seen and used other, similar fans that have cooling capabilities. Nothing like an air conditioner, of course, but just something that gives a little coolness to the air coming through the fan. A nice option on days that are warm but don't call for full AC. If I could, I'd return this & look for another product but I didn't realize it until we assembled it. It is my fault for trusting the search results and falling for their description but they knew what they were doing too. I am NOT a happy customer right now.

reviewTitle: Third time was not the charm.
reviewDescription: I purchased this fan and was looking forward to using it based on the positive reviews it has received. However, when it arrived and I set it up, this fan with four speed levels would only do levels 1 and 2. Levels 3 and 4 just hummed and did nothing. I notified customer service, which was very responsive - I have nothing bad to say about their service - and they sent me a replacement fan. This second fan had the exact same issue. I notified them again, and once more they sent me another replacement that I received today. Giving this one a try, I discovered the same issue once again.So, I've come to the conclusion that something is wrong with quality control at DREO because how many times would three separate fans have the same issue that prevents using the fan?I've requested a refund from customer service tonight and hope that will be processed quickly so I can purchase a fan that works.

reviewTitle: If you're looking for a strong fan, look elsewhere
reviewDescription: If you're expecting a powerful fan, buy something else. We bought this fan, expecting a very strong airflow, especially for the price, but at the max airflow, it's probably strong enough as most other fans on their lowest setting.We will be returning the fan and finding a new one.
Fan only worked for 2 days before it quit working.  Sent it back for refund

reviewTitle: Remote destroys a battery in 1 hour
reviewDescription: The fan showed up with the remote that did not work. We figured it was just a dead battery so ordered some replacements. But in new batteries and the remote worked fine… for about 1 hour. Then remote stopped working again. New battery same results. Tried a different set of batteries same result. Thanks Dreo for making this garbage and costing me 2 additional sets of batteries.

reviewTitle: I don’t even want to give it a review of any stars it’s so bad
reviewDescription: The fan just stopped working properly. It doesn’t respond to remote orders to change speed, turn on and off, rotate.  It can be on and set at one level and with no touch of any remote control or the device itself, will stop turning, or will lower its speed.
Fan doesn’t oscillates, knobs missing, No Manual, minor scraches NO RESPONSE FROM CUSTOMER SERVICE. Returning
I wait over a week in the middle of summer for this fan, and oh surprise it didn’t work. This is a really bad product and experience.
I have 3 Dreo fans in 2 years, 2 of these tower fans and one oscillating fan, they are all dead now.  I do not recommend.
The fan is very quiet, but I think it can only be used at level 4, the other levels are very weak.

This fan was very easy to setup from out of the box. Having different fan options makes it a more versatile fans than most, with a quiet options for when you want to sleep. Great quality for the price, especially with all of the setti ga and adjustments you can make with the remote. I've knocked it over a couple of times bit still seems durable and stable. The only setting that I can't figure out is auto. It seems to change between the fan modes randomly and cycles through them so I use the other options instead.

I love the fan!! What is keeping this review from being a 5 is because I didn't expect it to only work just over 2 year and die. Tried replacing the fuse in plug no success. Thank goodness the warranty I got at the time was a 5 year. So I reached out to DREO and Carol from their customer service was nice to work with and prompt in responding to my emails and getting me a replacement fan which arrived in 2 days. And I didn't have to send the broken one back which was a joy cause we know how that can be a hassle.
It's very quiet which is great because it's in the bedroom.  Very impressed with the amount of air it moves.

I chose this fan after having a previous tower fan. Won't ever go back to box fans. But I had to toss my other because it was tamper proof from opening back panel to thoroughly clean, and the motor died.  This one is easy to clean. The negative is the remote. The font and symbols are white on taupe panel. Harder to see and read than if they were black and bold.
This is not quiet. However it was easy to put together and it does work to cool down the room.

I've really become impressed by Dreo products. I have a space heater from them that is high quality, so I didn't hesitate when I saw this tower fan from them. And it doesn't disappoint. Sleek touch panel, easy to read display, and whisper quiet, which makes it great for watching TV and not having to crank up the volume. On speed 1 it feels like a cool mountain stream across your skin. 3 and 4 are louder but also more than enough to cool down a living room, nearly AC quality. There's a timer and a sleep function (which from what I can tell only turns off the bright LCD display in 2 seconds instead of 5). A slight annoyance is when pressing a button, the first press will only wake up the display. You then need to hit it again to actually perform your action, but I can live with this. I'm very glad I went with Dreo (again)!Update:  Okay, another slight annoyance. The fan is so quiet that, since the digital display goes black after a short time, we keep leaving it on when the room is empty. So good but also a little bad.
Works great & love the level of sound, just enough to make me fall asleep but not too loud.

Works almost as well as my previous one but on the upside, it’s very quiet. If you need the noise to sleep this is not the fan for you. Also light weight and a convenient handle for easy carrying. White looks good in my white interior home. Minus one star because it doesn’t provide as much cold air as my previous one. Still worth the purchase.
Works well, feels cool when the air hitts you. But its a bit loud on settings 3 and 4.
What a waste of my money.  You got to put this fan so close up to you to feel the air and that's on high.  I just went and brought a 20 dollar fan that works real good.

This fan is not worth the price. It works like a personal fan. It does not push out enough cool air to cool off 1 person. The highest speed does nothing. When it rotates, once it is off of you, the rest of the room is extremely hot. My room was a very small room and it did not cool it at all.
The fan worked fine for 1month. Then started making clicking noises. Quit that now sounds like a wounded animal.  I have other tower fans that are 2 yrs old and still working fine. This is JUNK!!!

reviewTitle: Just a regular fan, some basic cheaper fans might even do a better job.
reviewDescription: I was under the impression this would blow cold air, this works just as any basic fan would. There’s no cool air, it’s just regular air. I’m considering returning it and ordering a temperature controlled one from Walmart, since I can’t seem to find it on Amazon. Where you can set it to 75 degrees or 80 or whatever you’re wanting. I might try it out for a night & debate if I wanna keep it or not.
This fan is nice and quiet. I assume it would work on oscillating to move air around in a room. On 4, the highest speed, it does not put out a good breeze and does little to cool on a hot night.
I wish I didn’t throw the box away bc I’d return it. It doesn’t blow air that high and it makes the most annoying sounds when it’s in oscillate mode. Too expensive to not work properly

I purchased this fan in Feb 2023 when it was on sale. When hot weather arrived, I tried using it next to my bed overnight, but found 2 things I didn't like:  first, I'm used to speed indicator lights so I can make adjustments w/o turning lights on. The remote is also dark. I guess most people prefer it that way, but I didn't like having to turn the light on at 4am just to see controls on the fan.  Also, I realized 90° oscillation was just way too wide for next to the bed as the much needed breeze kept spending too much time above my head, then below my feet.Didn't use the fan again till the next heat wave 2mos later  with it placed in the hallway.  They were stingy with the electrical cord, at only 4ft. I turned it on high, then a little while later it was on low. Turned it back up, but turned itself back to low shortly after, and timer was now on.  Tried to turn it off, but couldn't, so set it to longest time, but still found it back on low a few minutes later. Useless.So for me, waste of time and money
Box arrived with a hole in it. Not to mention a box fan has more power than this. Definitely a let down and a waste of money. I would not reccomend this fan

I set the fan up right out of the box following instructions and when turned on it made a horrible noise and produced no air. After taking the fan apart and diagnosing the problem, the set screw on the fan blade had not been tightened correctly at the factory, I fixed the fan myself. This should have been done at the factory and is not only a safety issue but a quality issue. Fix your cheap crap at the factory before sending it to the buyer! Will not buy the product or brand again.

The set up was straightforward, but that means little since the fan didn’t work, right off the bat. It powered on, but would not oscillate. There was no troubleshooting info on this feature in the manual. We are going to try and replace it w/ the same model which I hope works.

I use this in a room that is on the top floor of my home which does not get a lot of AC or coolness unless the weather dictates that and so in this room I need to have it kind of climate controlled and I use this fan. It is automated so you can leave it in the room on on auto and it will pick up whether or not it needs to be high or low which I really do like there is, a remote that comes with it I don’t need like a Wi-Fi remote or something Bluetooth to my phone, but that might be a great option for someone who needs to have control when they’re not home but otherwise I think it’s a perfect purchase and I really really do love it. I’ve had it for almost a year now and it works great to keep that room cool when it needs to be cool.

reviewTitle: Bought it for my college floor’s common area
reviewDescription: This fan was placed in my college dorm’s common area and it’s great. It keeps the large room cool and has helped us get through the hot months. I wish it was able to push more air or swivel faster. It’s good for the price though. The remote is very useful. I would recommend it to anyone on a budget needing a fan.

reviewTitle: Not bad but definitely too quiet for white noise
reviewDescription: Has decent airflow, I use a fan to stay cool at night and to drown out the sound of my cats midnight zoomies, airflow is pretty strong but the white noise even on the highest setting does not compare to a circle floor fan. I will say the led display shuts off after a minute which I love, but If you want a quiet strong fan this is it if you want a loud one check elsewhere I’d place this at a medium-low tone for white noise. Also the base took literal seconds to put together if you’re struggling you don’t know how to follow the simplest of instructions

reviewTitle: Great air output, good oscillation, noisy switch
reviewDescription: I used this for going on two summers now and I very much like the #2 setting airflow for circulating air with minimal noise. My only complaint is that makes a loud beep every time you turn it off. And as with many new style appliances I've never even tried the remote.

Glad I made this purchase.  Lots of cool air blows our way at night with this fan that we use in the bedroom.  Air conditioning is a bit too cold, but this is perfect to keep a gentle cool breeze circulating.  And I love the remote.  Its small but it is powerful and even has a storage place in the back of the fan for it.  Nice product.

This fan is verry convient Ii like the power and if I get too cold I can just turn the speed down it has 4 power settings that make sleeping great. I've knocked it down meny times and it works as good as the day I got it. I wish there was an adjustable speed at witch it turns or a way too controll the direction it turns but other than that this fan is nice. It comes with a controller so you don't have too move too change the settings. Everything feels durable and nothing sounds loose or swueeks. I have no complaints at night it keeps me cool. Nothing

Bought this fan for my home office. Wanted something quiet but to keep the air moving while on conference calls. This fan is great. Almost completely silent on level 1 and 2. Levels 3-4 do increase the noise level but still much more quiet that some other fans I've purchased.

reviewTitle: Strong plastic smell, squeaks on oscillating mode, but low power consumption
reviewDescription: Works well with my jackery as well as my off grid solar system, the fan itself is quiet but It lost a star for the awful creaking sound it makes during rotation, and the plastic smell that is taking too long to go away. Overall decent fan.

I like the performance once I found the acceptable  level of cooling.  What I'm not happy with is the user manual and the difference of the remote verses the display on the control panel of the fan itself and the lack of explanation in the manual.

Can’t say haven’t used it yet weather been good but looks good  base easy to put together plugged it in works fine should be good when the time is right  seams to have good power and covers a good distance

I like the fan. It's really not quiet by any means but it blows well.  that's a plus. The cord could have been a little longer in order to be able to move it out in the room. Also you do need to stand about 5 feet away for the remote to pick up the signal.  So basically you got to get up.

reviewTitle: Nice fan, but too short for bedroom use.
reviewDescription: Nice fan and does a good job of cooling a small area of a room however the fans should go all the way up the tower not just 60% of it. Would be 5 stars if full tower was a fan.
Fan has 4 speeds. Easy to use, nice feature is the remote. It definitely does not get “cold” or cool it is literally just a fan that oscillates. It’s perfect for an extra breeze on a hot day!
This fan DOES NOT blow out cold air,while it is a good quality fan that does blow out cool refreshing air people are being misled into thinking it’s basically a portable AC which it is not
This fan does everything as advertised.  It would be nice if one could see the controls at night if you want to adjust it, but everything is completely black.  That's merely a minor inconvenience.

reviewTitle: A little loud on highest setting.
reviewDescription: Purchased this because last fan stopped oscillating. The range of oscillation on this fan is awesome, but running it on setting 4 would wake me up in the middle of the night, and keep me up.
I use this to help circulate my central air in my apartment. It works very nicely, just wish it was easier to clean as I have a cat and his hair gets caught in it.
It’s very quiet doesn’t take up much space, it takes a while to cool down a room however it’s very light and the remote is easy to use and was very easy to assemble
We used this in our living room. It is quiet and blows out a decent amount of air. It has multiple settings including a timer which is nice to set at night
Great buy! Powerful and quiet. If I had to say something negative it would be that you can't adjust the height unless you place it on top of something.
Not like it reviews if you need a fan for hot days don’t get this one

We have had this fan for 2 months. During that time, we have had no complaints. The fan worked as expected. Then my daughter, even after being told not to put things in the fan, put a fork in where the blade is. The plastic fins broke all apart. I contacted the company to see if I could purchase a replacement as it was completely our fault. They told me that they do not have replacement blades and that I would have to purchase a new fan. These fans aren’t the cheapest and now a perfectly good fan is going to the landfill. I will never purchase from this company again.
Not enough air flow. Had to put it right next to me to feel anything.

This fan is high powered and sleek but no matter what setting you put it on, it will go into some power saving mode and turn down to setting 1 in the middle of the night. Multiple times throughout the night I keep having to turn it back up and it sucks. I do not suggest for the money
With the price, I’d hoped this fan would be more powerful! It’s not!
Not as cool as I was expecting. I thought it was temperature controlled.

reviewTitle: no remote came with item, also no instruction manual??
reviewDescription: Cooling bedroom

reviewTitle: Fan doesn’t sit at consistent speed
reviewDescription: The first fan I had of you chose speed 3 at some point it would automatically die down to 1. I woke up multiple times a night to adjust the speed back. I asked for a replacement item and I have had it for about a week and I am noticing the fan will blow hard and you can hear the speed change down and go back up again. I’ve noticed similar complaints in the review so I think this is a product issue especially since the replacement doesn’t work right either. I would skip ordering this brand again.

It has speed levels 1-4, 4 being the highest speed. Feels like a medium low. All the features are great and as advertised. Remote control is great for convenience. It’s a bit shaky and the base doesn’t seem to have enough support. Power is weaker than I had hoped for
No me gustó, siento que no  llega a mucha distancia el aire !!!

Super easy to assemble. No tools required.Level 4 is the highest yoy can go and it certainly does help. I bought this because we didn't have an A/C and I'm glad I did. The level 1 and 2 don't really do anything at all, honestly.But it is super quiet. Even without the night time setting on. Remote works well, I haven't had any issues so far. It's not heavy, so it's easy to move and doesn't take up much space.I'll update again once I take it apart to clean!

I recently purchased this fan to use this summer.  It does a great job keeping the air moving.  We've had 100+ heat for over a week and it has been so helpful.  I don't need to turn the a/c on as early when I have the fan working.  It's quiet and looks great - it has sort of an art deco vibe to it.  The curved top reminds me of a petite grandmother's clock!  Two minor negatives that dropped the rating down a point:  the high-pitched sound when adjusting the controls and the slightly awkward angle for pressing the controls.  I prefer the slanted top of my old Honeywell fan - it was easier to access.
This fan is cool but it doesn't physically rotate. Bummer, but it is cool, and i mean temp wise.

reviewTitle: A decent fan to circulate air in small rooms
reviewDescription: This fan is marketed as “high velocity”. I would not agree with that, but it does do the job.
Great fan work amazing they just lied about it coming with a remote kinda sucks but Great fan

I had been looking for a fan that would not be too expensive. I came across this unit and decided to give it a try. This fan works well for small spaces. I have it in bedroom and move it around because is light and easy to carry. It may be a bit noisy at times. The options are easy to set up. Good purchase for the price.
Fácil de montar el soporte y el modo silencioso mejor de lo que me pensaba
Blows out cool air love the noise volume as well but kinda hard to clean
Good fan if you can’t afford a A/C. Down side it leans over.
Pretty good fan but was hoping for a little more output from fan

Bought this fan for this hot summer for my son’s room!  It done the job of keeping him cool.  Some fans blow hot air, this one actually blew a cool breeze and we absolutely love it!  Will be purchasing a second one!

Bought it cause my house stays around 80 in summertime, plugged it in and immediately gave me cold air. For the function that it was needed , it keeps me refreshed. Absolutely worth it, jus sucks it ain’t as wide as I thought lol

This is a must buy product! My huaband and I have bought 2 of these fans already due to how much we love them! They are super effective and cool fast. They also have the ability to be set to a certain amount of time. This is a super quiet fan! We use it in our kids room at night

Bought this for my sister who already had two tower fans made by other companies. She didn't like either and seldom used them. When she turned this fan on for the first time, she was literally blown away. She junked her old fans.

This little fan is perfect to circulate the air.  I just sent one to my daughter and she absolutely loves it so she is getting another one.  Great price, slender, and blows cool air.  What more could ya ask for?

This fan moves a substantial amount of air and can create a breeze in a room from 15' away.  It is also very quiet.  The form factor is nice and compact.  Highly recommend this fan, especially over a conventional round bladed fan.

I ordered this during heatwave. AC died and I ordered fans and this was one of them. I loved it! Quiet, out of the box plug in, powerful and attractive. I wouldn't hesitate to order it again and I am well pleased!

We have loved this fan! The size of it is perfect and nice for small spaces. There are multiple settings for this fan and it is very easy to adjust to your needs. We have been using it now for a couple of weeks and have had no issues. I just wish we purchased this sooner because it has been a lifesaver during some of these hotter days we've been having. I would highly recommend this fan!

This fan works super well, and it only took 5 minutes to assemble. I didn't need any tools to put it together, just bare hands. The remote is really nice to use it anywhere from the room, and it's a powerful fan

This Tower Fan with the circulating feature allows the air to flow in 180 degrees and really does a fine job of covering a large room.  I would definitely recommend this product.  It has made my Family Room so much more comfortable!

My husband and I were looking to buy a strong fan for the summer and this one is perfect. It has multiple settings for comfort, it has a remote, and it has 4 different modes. The best part is that this fan is quiet and it's strong.

It’s easy to put together, easy simple instructions for how to use it. Easy to figure out if you don’t read the instructions. Silent, so quietly blowing the air around when you’re sleeping! It’s a huge difference in a hot room with no air conditioning! This fan is great! Even withstanding little children’s attempts to take it down!I highly recommend this fan!

I received my Dreo Tower Fan for the bedroom today, just in time for a spike in our outdoor temperature.  I immediately cooled my room to a very comfortable temperature.  I am very happy with this item for several reasons.  First, it fits into the decorum of my room beautifully.  It doesn’t take up a lot of room; nor does it stand out as an eyesore, as many big, round pedestal fans do.  This is a very slim tower with the fan(s) hidden from plain sight.  It is very quiet, and doesn’t drown out the television.  This is important to me, as I have a small bedroom in a residential care facility.  I have to keep the volume of my TV low so as not to disturb the other residents living here.  The fan immediately started cooling my room, and within a relatively short period of time it had my room at a very comfortable temperature.  The fan has many features that I am sure I will enjoy using such as a sleep feature, a timer, and a variable oscillating function.  Best of all the fan is controlled by a remote.  This is important for me, as I am disabled, and pretty much confined to my bed.  With the remote feature, I won’t have to jump in and out of bed, or call upon my caregiver to help me operate this appliance.  For it’s price, it is well worth every penny.The only negative thing I can say about the fan is there were no detailed instructions included with it.  Having an instruction booklet would have made it easier to learn the use of its many features more efficiently.  I have had to learn by trial and error, which hasn’t been a major issue for me, as it might be for other purchasers of this item.

reviewTitle: The Best Fan You Can Ever Buy
reviewDescription: This product is worth than 5 stars. This is one of the best fans I have ever bought or recieved in my life.About the fan that I love:Speed: It has 4 amazing silent yet powerful speeds. It energy efficient and can cool down your room all with super powerful speed.Remote: It comes with a remote control with allows you to control without having to use the on screen buttons.Instalation: this fan is super easy to install with a step by step will explained directions on how to install everything.Versatility: This fan can be used while you sleep, away from home with a time mode. It even has a rotate mode where it spins around for you, insuring every single part of your room is cooled down efficiently.Warranty: This product came with a Warranty inside the box. It was a 30 month warranty offer for free. All you had to was scan the QR code, create an account, and then add the Amazon order number. Super simple fast and quick to do.This product is one of the most recommended product on Amazon and it lives up to Multitude of amazing reviews. This product is a must buy!!!

The tall slim design helps to minimize the space it takes up.  Does not feel wobbly.  Has a remote, but manual is very easy.  Fan is not overly loud and creates a nice breeze.  This is perfect to use in a hall or bedroom.

What a great tower fan!  Fairly quiet on the high setting, can't even hear it on the lower settings. Cools my living room beautifully and would be perfect for a bedroom too. Easy to assemble, I didn't even need to look at the instructions. Sturdy too. Have had it only a few weeks so longevity is unknown but I'm very pleased so far.

This fan was the best thing I've purchased by far on Amazon. It's super powerful, blows cold air and has many functions and options. My spouse is now fighting me over which side of the bed gets it. I'm thinking another purchase is in the near future.

reviewTitle: Pretty good fan. Read complete review to understand more
reviewDescription: Complete review:1. Assembly and Structure - 5starsThe fan is very easy to assemble no tools required, just snap the two base pieces and then snap the tower on the base. The power cord in 60inches(5feet) long. Comes with nice small remote that operates with CR2025 3V battery(included). Easy to carry handle provided at the back top. And also below the handle there is holder for the remote. Touch panel allows to change options on the fan directly with out the remote and the dislay turnsoff after 30seconds automatically.2. Noise - 4starsThis fan is promoted as quieter fan and see lot of reviews even suggesting the same. But i dont agree to that comparing it to my previous tower fan, i feel the noise level is almost the same at high speed. But the noise really wont disturb your sleep unless your very sensitive to noise. Just place the tower fan on the other side of the bed or TV so that noise doesnt disturb.If placing on carpet ensure the base is almost flat, generally tower fans if they are slanted can make noise over the long run.3. Performance and consumption - 5starsAt max speed(4) it really blows plenty of air which you can feel upto 12-14feet, so it might be good for large rooms too.At max speed(4) it probably consumes 42W and it will be little lower at lesser speeds. Use the timer function to turn off automatically that surely saves money.4. Features: 5starsRemembers all the settings except timer when turned off.i) Timer - This is a must have feature commonly found on these tower fans. Can set timer from 1hour to 8hours. Generally i set at night before sleep so that it automatically turns off in the morning. This really helps in saving costs, because some day we can always forget to turnoff due to other distractions.ii) Speeds - there are 4 speed levels(1-4).iii) Rotation - It does make a perfect 90 degree rotation and the movement is smooth and silent.iv) Modes - There are 4 modes. but really sleep & normal modes are generally used.a.
