Normal - Probably most used mode. Fan runs at constant speed.b. Sleep - Fan speed decreases every 30min and max reduces two speed levels.For level 4: 4 -> 3 -> 2For level 3: 3 -> 2 -> 1For level 2: 2 -> 1 (reduces only one level)For Level 1: 1(no change)Its a nice power saving feature but i felt instead of 30min should have been every 2hours.c. Auto - Its says the fan adapts to the ambient temperature but not sure how its possible in this model since it doesnt have any temperature reader. Some models have temperature reader which may be possible in thosed. Natural - Says fan runs in alternating speeds but really not sure on what basis.v) Remote Volume - A beep sound will be heard on changing optionsvia the touch panel or the remote. We can turnon/off this beep sound.5. Safety - 5starsThe gap in the grills are very small on all the sides and the rotating wheel is an inch inside, so i feel it should be safe with kids and pets around.The power plug has an inbuild fuse which would protect the fan from against any overload or short-circuit.6. Cleaning - 5starsI believe this is the only tower fan that has the option to open the rear grill and the rotor wheel, so that we can wash it. Previous tower fan i used to use the vaccuum with less success. This is one of the best feature.7. Warranty - 5starsComes with a default 1year warranty and it can be extended to 5 years if we register in dreo website. Details specified in the user manual.

This man is quiet. He has four settings and on four it’ll blow you out of the room. I replaced an old fan that lasted seven years and I’m very happy with it even the lights turn out after it runs for 30 seconds when you set it up so that at night, it doesn’t light the room. I would definitely recommend it.

This fan works great for hot Florida nights and hot flashes. I love the variety of speeds. Usually level 2 cools great while still being quiet. Higher levels work great during workouts. I also love the additional features like oscillation setting. Very easy to use.

Can’t say enough good things. Great fan. Sooo quiet! Very powerful. We hardly ever use it on the highest settings because the lower ones are enough. Assembles in about 2 minutes. Just a really good quality piece of equipment. Looks nice too. We use it under the awning on the deck when there’s no natural wind. Great on the screened-in porch as well. You won’t be disappointed.

Got this to help with the summer heat & love love love it!! Kind of want another for another part of my house. It puts out very cold air & has adjustable settings. It is a little noisy once you get to like 3-4 on the settings, but if you like white noise, youll be fine! I like the remote as well. Dont even gotta get up to turn it on/off.

We had an old tower fan (with blades) that went on the fritz and was very noisy.  I did a lot of looking and decided to replace it with this one.  What a winner!  The fan has numerous modes, including a quiet night-time mode and it's SUPER quiet and smooth.  You hardly know it's running when it's set on the 1 or 2 speed.  I have this one in the bedroom and am getting ready to order one for our great room.  Using a fan saves us a lot of money on A/C during the hot, humid summers in Middle Tennessee.  You can't go wrong with this fan.  It's a great value for what you get.

reviewTitle: Customer service goes above and beyond
reviewDescription: I just want to say, dreo’s customer service goes above and beyond. I bought this fan in October 2023. Fan was still going strong but somehow the bottom of fan started to get wear out from moving around in my room. I contacted customer service told them about the issue how it wasn’t standing anymore. I spoke with Tina, she asked for pictures and immediately took action and replaced my fan. Thank you! Company’s that take accountability for their products and stand behind it makes me want to buy more of their products because I know I can trust them. Will definitely buy again and recommend to anyone.

I purchased this because summer time is really hot. It fits perfecting in my living room, sometimes I move it to my bedroom. It's very quiet and powerful. I have black our curtains and direct sunlight doesn't come into my living room. The fan is all I need to keep me cool.

reviewTitle: Best fan I have ever had
reviewDescription: My A/C was limping along and set at 80 degrees. This fan helped so much with keeping me cooler when temperatures outside were 100 degrees.  Even at highest level, it doesn’t seem that loud to me. The amount of air it puts out is better than anything I have used before. 😍

I liked this fan so much I ended up buying two more Dreo fans. I bought 2x Cruiser Pro T2s (DC motors). Found the extra height over the Nomad One to be beneficial as well as the esthetics to be an improvement for a marginal price increase. I was concerned that going from box fans and big standing round fans that I would lose to much air movement, but these things do very well and are much quiter. They look great around the house as well. We will see how the longterm quality holds up, but they appear to be well built.

It moves the air. I particularly like the remote option. It’s not as quiet as I’d hoped but it actually has a white noise quality. I’ve not tried the timer but the option is nice. Glad I bought it  - so much better than the stand fan I was using!

I like that it as different modes. When I go to sleep, I put it on sleep mode, so it won't be too loud. I also like the timer feature, so it can be turned off when I'm asleep. It was easy to put together and sturdy enough, to where I can place it on top of a little bench, so I can have more air towards me.

I will admit, it’s not as POWERFUL as I expected it to be but it’s still pretty good! It has 4 different settings and an option to turn off the sound it makes when you change something! It also has a timer incase you want it on only for a certain amount of hours! I’ve had it for a few months so far and it still works really good!

When I received the package the fan box was damaged and ripped open. It blows cool air but the highest setting of the fan is not that strong. If your looking for a fan that blows air strongly I would not recommend this product.

It was good for a year or so, but then it started making a loud noise when trying to rotate, then stopped rotating altogether. A little disappointing for a product that’s best selling on Amazon. I expected much better.I’d stay away. I submitted a ticket with the manufacturer on their website. I will update my review here if they stand by their product and send me another one, under warranty. I don’t have high hopes yet but we will see.

reviewTitle: Not enough for a large living room
reviewDescription: It would be nice for a bedroom maybe but does nothing for a large room.

reviewTitle: Was great for a few months even bought a second one
reviewDescription: After a few month it developed a hum customer service was great sent me out a second fan. which had the hum already, now i have 3 fans, that all have a electric motor hum louder than the fan.
its fine but if id used it before buying , i wouldnt have purchased.

reviewTitle: Airflow was disappointingly not that strong
reviewDescription: This is a great fan for sleeping at night with the air directed at your bed. It is quiet and the one to one air flow is perfect. This is not a great fan for use in a room where there has to be any distance between the fan and the person or persons receiving the air flow.  Level 4 felt like it was still on a low air setting. Level 4 is only good in a direct fan to person setting. The remote is not super sensitive. You have to have it directed precisely at some sweet spot though I really haven't figured out where that is yet.

It was easy to set up and use, it took only 5 minutes to do so and its so quiet, however, I'm seeing all these comments how it blows such cool air but it really doesn't. I hate to be that person but it really is just an overpriced box fan that comes with a remote control, and if its really warm or hot in your room, all your going to get is warm air. I thought from the description that it would blowout cool air, since it has it listed as a AC, not Fan. In my opinion a metal bladed fan blows out much cooler air than this does. I was excited to get it, but now I'm actually disappointed.

Lasted from 7/28/22 until 1/8/24. A year and a half for a $70 fan. I really don’t believe I got my money’s worth. Plus the power decreased rapidly after the first year. Lot of fancy bells and whistles but I’d rather have something that lasts

reviewTitle: Not a happy customer AT ALL
reviewDescription: This is ridiculous.  I spent $70 on this fan and it's a complete waste.  Watch my video for my detailed orientation.  After making this video I tried it in my living room to see if it would handle a broader space area.  For a bit it worked okay but now it's barely blowing even out of the middle area. Returning for a full refund and it's back to the drawing board for me. You know that expression "you get what you pay for"? Well, I think $70 is a high price for it to work like it's only $10.  If I was going to 'get what I pay for' this fan should blow my pillows off of my bed. Jeeesh
I was happy that it finally arrived, and now it doesn’t even turn on tried everything.

reviewTitle: This fan IS as quiet as the other reviews claim
reviewDescription: Like other folks among these reviews, I'm very, very sensitive to sound when I sleep, and I have needed a really quiet fan for the bedroom. I tried the Honeywell tower fan, because it had a lot of positive reviews, but even on its lowest setting, I could hear a kind of rhythmic "whomp whomp whomp" reverberating up through the floorboards, just enough to distract me from falling asleep. On the Dreo's lowest setting, however, I don't hear anything--just a very quiet air whoosh which doesn't bother me. And the air flow of the lowest setting provides enough coolness with the quiet that allows me to fall asleep. The next highest setting is quiet, too. I never write reviews but I relied so much on other people's reviews to help me find the right fan, that I wanted to reinforce the help I got here for the sake of other people. This fan really is a super quiet one!

reviewTitle: Is it possible to be too cold?
reviewDescription: I bought this for a living room fan to replace a 20 inch box fan.I wouldn't be able to use it for my bedroom fan because it's too quiet and I need it to block out other noises in a house with 5 people and 2 dogs.It's great in the living room that it's quiet because you can still hear the TV.I have it in front of the air conditioner vent like I did the box fan but since this one is tall it blows up on my face more and makes it a lot colder in front of the AC vent.I usually only have to keep it on setting 1 or 2. The only time I went higher was when it was in the upper 90s outside then the oven got used and it was 77 inside the house.

reviewTitle: A MUST For Those Hot Summer Days
reviewDescription: I purchased my first of these almost two years ago, and when I saw it going on sale earlier this year I KNEW I had to get a second one ahead of the summer months. These little guys whip up the perfect gust of wind to keep your summer heatstroke at bay, and the remote feature is an absolute game changer. They do need to be cleaned out every once in a while if you're living with pets or with a regular influx of dust (New Yorkers are in an out, so a little extra dusting has to happen here and there) but the back lid pops right off, giving you access to 90% than any other tower fan's I've seen where you pretty much just have to eyeball the dusting by poking around). 10/10 would recommend!

reviewTitle: One of my favorite buys ever
reviewDescription: It's so easy to use. I LOVE the fact it has a remote. It's fairly powerful. It goes up to "4" power, so it's not super powerful that it will cool a whole room, but it will keep you cool if you have it nearby. I personally use it in my bedroom and it keeps me perfectly cool at night. I have also used it when I'm in my living room and it works well there too.Features: It oscillates. It has a feature where it will slowly turn down the power across some hours if you don't want it running on full all of the time. It also has a sleep timer feature as well.Absolutely worth the money for this moderately powerful fan with a remote. Good quality. 10/10

reviewTitle: Efficient Cooling and Whisper-Quiet Operation: A Bedroom Essential
reviewDescription: The Dreo Tower Fan for Bedroom has become an indispensable part of my home, offering exceptional cooling performance with a level of quiet operation that's truly impressive. Designed with both functionality and comfort in mind, this fan stands out as a reliable companion during hot summer days and nights.First and foremost, the fan's airflow velocity of 25ft/s ensures rapid and effective cooling throughout my bedroom. Whether I'm working, sleeping, or relaxing, the fan circulates air efficiently without creating disruptive noise. Its whisper-quiet operation allows me to enjoy a peaceful environment without any distractions, making it perfect for both daytime use and nighttime sleep.The 90° oscillation feature is another highlight, ensuring that cool air reaches every corner of the room. This wide-angle oscillation maximizes airflow distribution, creating a consistently comfortable environment even in larger spaces.I also appreciate the sleek and space-saving design of the tower fan, which fits seamlessly into any bedroom decor. The compact footprint makes it easy to place anywhere without taking up valuable floor space, while the intuitive control panel and remote control offer convenient operation from across the room.Overall, the Dreo Tower Fan for Bedroom exceeds expectations with its powerful cooling capabilities, quiet operation, and user-friendly design. If you're looking for a reliable and efficient cooling solution that enhances comfort without compromise, I highly recommend considering this tower fan for your bedroom or any living space.

I’m very sensitive to noise, and this fan is barely a whisper! In fact, on its lowest level, I can’t even hear that it’s on - yet it puts out a solid airflow. My room is quite small, but unless I’m having a hot flash, the lowest speed is all I need. The only thing that would make the fan better Would be too make the screen options more visible. I use the remote, but yesterday when I was near the fan and wanted to adjust it, I couldn’t see the options because it’s just a dark black screen. Still, I wouldn’t trade this fan for anything. If you are very sensitive to noise, this is the fan for you.

reviewTitle: Keeps Me Cool and Looks Great!
reviewDescription: I recently got the Dreo Tower Fan, and I love it! It's super sleek and doesn't take up much space, which is awesome for my small apartment.**Design:**The design is really modern and cool. The fan looks great in any room, and the LED display is easy to read.**Performance:**This fan is a powerhouse! It has different speed settings and can oscillate, so it spreads the cool air all around. Plus, it's really quiet, so it doesn't bother me while I'm watching TV or sleeping.**Convenience:**Setting it up was a breeze, and the remote control makes it super easy to change settings from my couch or bed. I love the timer feature too – I can set it to turn off after a while, which is perfect for when I’m going to sleep.**Energy Efficiency:**It’s also nice to know it’s energy efficient, so it’s not hiking up my electricity bill.**Overall:**The Dreo Tower Fan is a fantastic buy! It looks great, works really well, and is super convenient. Definitely recommend it if you need a good fan!

reviewTitle: DREO replaced the product based on their warranty program
reviewDescription: I live in a very dry climate so the Tower Fan was necessary to circulate air at night . The fan however developed a ringing sound over time that interfered with sleeping. I called DREO thinking there might be a quick fan.  TRACY (HESUNG) at DREO requested a sound movie which I sent. TRACY reviewed it. Granted a warranty replacement which I just received and surprise "you may keep the misbehaving Tower, or recycle it. TRACY said, "you've been hassled enough! Your satisfaction is our priority" Nice to deal with someone who stands by their product. THANKS TRACY (HESUNG) . THANKS DREO!!

I was living in SoCal where it doesn’t get too hot.. then this year I moved to the mid Atlantic during a heat dome… so I needed something to help get me through that. Now, I did think that this fan was a little pricey, but my comfort is important so I bought it. It is worth every penny. It is powerful on 4, and on 4, it creates just enough noise to help me sleep. But the other settings are much quieter and still effective if that’s what you want. Just note on assembly that you need to put the base together first before you attach it to the fan itself. It is very sturdy when put together properly! Also I’ve used it in small rooms and large rooms and it really is effective in both because of the many settings.

reviewTitle: So durable and perfect for any room!
reviewDescription: Something that I definitely love is their quiet feature, I leave it on setting one which is the lowest one, but you can still feel it, and I turn on the quiet feature, and you can so easily forget you have it on, because it's so quiet, and I absolutely love it. As well you can have it standing far from you, and you still feel the breeze that it makes. I love how durable it is, the handle that it has, so you can easily carry it room from room- and for the price I think it's very good!
The fan can barely reach over the bed frame.
Doesn’t really do anything. Pretty pathetic. Loud for no reason. Changing the settings doesn’t do anything they’re all the same
Needed more of a breeze

Updated postThe remote is still terrible but now the fan can't run for more than a few minutes at speeds of 2,3 or 4 without automatically switching itself back down to 1. Not very helpful.Original PostThe fan works great, I can feel a lot of air movement, good swivel, easy to use display. The remote that comes with it however is horrible. The fan sits 1.5 feet from me at the edge of my desk and the remote only works part of the time. If my forearm is in the way, forget it, even within 2 feet it needs a perfectly clear line of sight. I definitely regret not getting a wifi one now.
This one was missing a stand
En países del trópico, caluroso no funciona, otro abanico más en la casa

reviewTitle: Completely dies if you unplug without turning it off
reviewDescription: I unplugged it to move the fan, and it died. Will not come back to life. Have to replace sadly, as it was otherwise a great fan that looks nice too.
Does not work with Alexa ! It arrived late and now the price has gone down! I'm so disappointed However it was very easy to set up

The fan quit working after 2 months, however the customer service was amazing and easy to work with. They sent me a replacement fan after needing a video of a fan that won't turn on along with all the other details. I haven't received it yet and hope it lasts longer than the first when I do but as far as customer service goes, they were great to work with. I never want to need customer service but if I do, I hope they are all this easy to work with for what it's worth.

When I purchased this fan, it was advertised as "Cooling". Like a dummy, I assumed this was temperature controlled and could help cool my upstairs office. Title seems to be intentionally misleading and trying to pull in folks looking for that detail. It's about as cooling as sitting in front of a fan in a hot room. Don't wanna go through the hassle of returning, but feel very mislead and won't be purchasibg from this seller again. Best part about the fan is that it has a remote. That's it. Nothing incredible, not really worth the money IMO.

I bought this to use as a fan to use while sleeping, but at speeds 1 and 2 it is very loud and I cannot sleep. I had one from different company that was quiet but was old and I wanted to replace it with this one because it had good reviews.  I was was wrong, should have kept the the old one.
The fan does not blow hard enough despite other reviews that say it does, that’s why I took a chance on it. Save yourself the disappointment .

Reviewed in the United States on May 31, 2024Fan was advertised as 'quiet', however, in fact, it is uncomfortably loud. I do not turn it on given the loudness over my tv, unfortunately. Would return, but have already thrown out the box.

Purchased this product because of the great reviews. I guess the old saying don’t believe everything you read is true. 4 speed settings, 4 being the highest and it barely blows any air at all. Major disappointment don’t waste your money !!

Worked great for a couple days then got very weak. Tried cleaning it but still not very impressed. If i could return this i would. Only a month old.Go for something like Vornado 👍 Just got one and very pleased with it
The price is too high to not work well! $30 fans are stronger!

I would not recommend this fan. I received this fan as a gift for Christmas. The fan worked perfectly for about a week then began making the noise in the video. I reached out to Dreo support, they responded to me a few times then ghosted me. I finally gave up on looking for answers so I decided to return it. I took it to the UPS store and then had to buy a box to ship it back which cost me $16. This entire experience was frustrating.
I purchased this fan for use in my bedroom! The fan has been unusable due to the loud noise it makes at all speeds! I am I unable to use this product! How do I make arrangements for return/refund??
Nada agradable con lo que se describe en los detalles del artículo
This fan barely blows air. It’s one of the worst I’ve owned.

I bought this fan on July 9th and it was working so well until recently it started making this horrible noise. Unfortunately since I bought it a month ago today, Amazon won't let me return it. I move into college next weekend and bought this for my dorm but unfortunately I don't think I can use it. I reached out to DREO so hopefully they message back. I really liked this fan so that's unfortunate.

This is NOT item for a 80 year old to order.  It is VERY HEAVY and awkward to move around and assemble. However once set up I found that 5 or so inches of the top do not send out any air so, for me, if left on the floor it will cool under your chair and desk.  So I took a drawer out of a small bureau and put the fan on it, raising it to cool more above (me) when I sit at the computer.  It does provide cooling air but I would not buy it again

I had fallen victim to the TikTok craze and bought the fan because i believed the hype. The Draco fan has garnered significant attention for its sleek design and advanced features, but it ultimately falls short of the hype. Despite claims of superior airflow and whisper-quiet operation, I can confirm it only does moderate performance and finding it no more effective than your basic standard fans. The fan's noise level is fine but the airflow is contrary to its advertising, especially at higher speeds there is none lol. Overall, the Draco fan doesn't justify its premium price tag or lofty promises.

We’ve been using this fan for a little over a year. The screw in the back does NOT want to come out, and the vents inside get so dirty so quickly. When I try to clean the inside of the fan, I have no chance of getting the screw out of the back without a magnetic screwdriver. It’s gotten so loud and rattles when I try to have it at full blast. Also when I cleaned it last, the vent slats kept breaking off as I tried to wipe them down. Very disappointing after only a year of owning it

I love the size. it fits in my bedroom nicely. I have a small room, and I was looking for a sleek design that doesn't take a bunch of room. Im really bummed because this fan is definitely whisper quite on its highest setting. I need more sound, as the pedastal gives me. I was trying to go compact, but it doesn't look like I can. This will be returned. I'm sure other people will love it. The whole thing oscillates.not just the center part. It's not real heavy.  I'm sure children & pets will be able to knock it down. easy to use. remote works fine. Just not loud enough for me.
Quite disappointed in this fan! Doesn't really blow and for the price I expect it to blow my wig back. I gave it two stars because its quite.
Really liked the fan but only last 2 years before it stopped working. I think there is an issue with the cord and can't get working
Cost too much for the amount of air that come out. Goes up to a 4 but feels like barely anything at all. :(

reviewTitle: Fine if you’re sitting no more than 3 feet away from it
reviewDescription: I have a tiny Vornado I got on sale for like $30 that gives better air flow and with more distance, it just doesn’t oscillate or have a remote. This fan is absolutely garbage unless you’re using to blow already cooler air around. Waste of money.

I purchased this tower fan to place beside my bed at night. For as big as this fan is the power behind it is lacking. I placed this fan less than 5ft from my bed and could not feel it while laying down. The remote would only work while right on top of the unit. If I need to be that close for it to work than what is the point of having the remote? This fan would work great when it was in a room completely alone. Yet when i moved the unit to my bedroom it would no longer cool like it did in the wide open space. This was tested with both the while it was and wasn't oscillating. I am highly disappointed with this product.

We've been using this fan for a month now and it has been fantastic! It is very quiet, even when rotating. The height is perfect, it doesn't take up a lot of room and it has been a great addition to our home.

I selected this model mainly because it would arrive before a heat wave. I recommend the 42” if using in the bedroom or where furniture in the middle of the room may obstruct the air flow unless you don’t mind it right next to you. I personally don’t prefer fans blowing directly on me. I took this one to my office and it works perfectly there. Ended up buying two other Dero 42” models. Features all three models have that are fabulous are a mute option to turn off button sounds and the display lights go completely out after about a minute. Must for sleepers who can’t stand sound and lights like me! All the remotes work for all three units. This is convenient if you lose one. Not so much if you have more than one fan running and are within range of the remote.

I was a little skeptical of slim tower fans for a long time, but I also needed a slimmer fan unlike the boxy floor fan that I had for some years. It died after four years of daily use, RIP. However, this fan was easy to assemble and had clear, simple instructions. It comes with a small remote that had uncomplicated controls and allows you to mute the sounds for when you want no beeping as you navigate the modes. Natural air flow setting feels AMAZING when you're resting or even sleeping, like you're outside under the stars on a camping trip. I highly recommend this brand and this fan. An instant favorite and a lifelong customer. Thanks, Dreo!

reviewTitle: Great, quiet fan and good customer service
reviewDescription: Fan is very quiet, remote is great and love the sleep timer.  Ours did not oscilate so I reached out to the seller and Tina provided quick and wonderful customer service and got us a working model in no time.

None of these fans are quiet on high speed.  But, this one blows cooling air at the lowest setting.  And, since I got it I have left the room a few times and forgot to turn it off because it is so quiet. I also have a Honeywell Quietset tower fan.  This one has twice the cool at lower settings up and down the scale.  Also, if this fan was on oscillate when you turned it off, it remembers that next time you turn it on.  On the Honeywell, you have to turn the oscillate function back on each time you turn it on.In summary:  The Dreo fan is quiet, cools nicely on the lowest setting, and remembers its oscillate setting.
This works like it says and helps the bedroom stay cool. It also helps the air conditioning run less.  I believe it should help the electric bill be lower. So in the long run it should save me money.

I am missing ceiling fans in my home and was in need of fans to move the air around in various areas. I had purchased other fans and they worked ok, but one failed so I ordered this fan to replace that. The air flow on these fans is substantial/noticeably higher and this fan is actually quieter. These fans are so good that I wound up giving the original ones away and getting more. I have not had them long enough to determine reliability, but performance is absolutely the best!

10/10 best fan I've ever had.  My apartment is on the top floor and I have no A/C.  Box fans never did the job, vornado fan never did the job. I am now finally able to sleep without melting.  This fan keeps you COOL.  Buy this fan you won't regret it.
I never knew I needed a tower fan until I finally bought one. Low noise which doesn't bother me at night and I can program it to turn off by however many hours I set it to. Truly needed.

We received this fan really quick at a reasonable price. The size is perfect and it creates good esthetic. It keeps the entire room nice and cool and you have several strength options. It is nice and quiet.

The fan is not powerful. It doesn’t really feel like it makes a difference, so I keep it off and just use the ceiling fan. I bought this fan for my bedroom and a Vornado for the living room. The Vornado is way better.
Stopped after 28 days, just inside the return window. I'm disappointed because it was a nice fan and the remote worked well.

The only good things about this fan were the quietness and the airflow. The oscillating function quit working less than 5 minutes after I hit the Power button. I have an email in to Customer Support - will most likely return it, though.

reviewTitle: Fan not functional in adjusting height
reviewDescription: Product was not what expected in hot weather settings are ok fan height adjustment isint set for a high bed setting

Had this fan for about a year until the oscillating function just stopped working one day out of nowhere. I’m assuming I had a defective fan, because it otherwise was a pretty good product that I enjoyed for a short time.

I purchased this fan based on the glowing reviews about the strength of the air and how it can effectively cool off a room. I am not sure if we all got the same fan because this is one of the weakest fans I’ve ever used, my 15 dollar big box fans circulate more air. I would do a bit more research or possibly look for a better brand
I bought this as a quiet fan.Great until put on sleep modeRattling, so useless!

Everyone's reviews seem positive. Maybe I'm just unlucky. But I've kept it well maintained and cleaned and the power of it has significantly died. It does not blow as hard as it used to. And I have owned it for only 3 months. But from my honest review. It has not helped keep me cool or air circulated since the power has died down

reviewTitle: Loud, barely cool air. Not worth it.
reviewDescription: What a disappointment. It’s loud. And I’ve tried to use the quiet function multiple times and it’s broken, because it doesn’t change. It doesn’t blow cool air either. I know it’s not an AC, I wasn’t expecting cold air. But I’ve experienced plenty of tower fans with much cooler air than this. Will be returning.

I’m a little disappointed with the fact that I paid a pretty decent amount for a fan that I thought would do the job. Unfortunately, that is not the case. I was really excited to set it up and get it started. When I did, the air felt like the same air that blows out with a box fan. If I had know that, I would’ve just purchased on of those and for a cheaper price. I even put it all the way up to level 4 and it still blows lukewarm air instead of “cool” air. I’m not impressed.

I like everything about this fan, the remote and the various options. Love the quite cool. My only disappointment was, the box was not sealed properly.  It was open along the seam.  I was thinking the fan may be damaged but everything was there and nothing was damaged.

The fan is very quiet on the lowest two settings. The highest setting (4) is about as loud as the lowest setting on my old tower fan. On the lowest setting, it's barely noticeable above the background noise of my central air conditioner or of the road traffic from outside.The remote control works well and is easy to use. The control panel would be better with real buttons, but it works well enough. The display lights turns off after a short time, which is nice if you want it for sleeping.

Running the AC in my home was making my electric bill sky rocket and I needed a solution. I use this fan in my bedroom. So far so good, I really like the different speeds and I feel like this fan fits my needs. Covers my whole room nicely.

This is a lifesaver on hot days. Especially when cooking. I simply point the fan at me and have it rotate. I'm actually able to cook during the summer. Helps me out so much. I love this fan. The remote is a nice bonus as well. I recommend this

They bought a bunch of these for my local mosque because it's super hot in the prayer rooms in summer and all the similar products said they were just going with this brand anyway because it was most reliable for the money and I was sold. I overheat at night and I was having to crank down the temperature to stay cool and freezing everyone else in the house. This was a perfect solution to that. Now I can freeze myself out in my own room all I want without too much noise or bothering anyone else in the house. It works fabulous and I have a pretty tall bed frame and it still cools over it just fine. Just no complaints about this fan at all I don't even need it at full power to keep me cold but I will add my room isn't very big at all.

I was skeptical because I initially saw this product on Tik tok and people kept saying it was blowing cold air and it was the best fan they ever had. So I found it here in Amazon and I knew if the reviews were wrong I could return it. But this fan is amazing. It blows air super far, at least 10 ft and I could still feel the air flow. I know it isn’t creating cold air but my room is the hottest room in the house and I am usually sweating and I am actually COLD in my room. I’m very happy with these fans. The positive reviews were right, and I read the negative reviews. I don’t get it. Some people said they get no air flow??? That’s crazy. Clearly lies. This is worth the price.

Keeps us cold on a level one fan speed with the rotating setting. Our bedrooms not tiny but it’s not huge either, either way I’m happy with the purchase. Super easy to set up, I haven’t lost the remote yet but I’m glad that it’s also touch screen

I need it to be cool in my room when I sleep and this works perfectly.  It cools the entire room. It is very quiet and the remote control is an added bonus. The lights also go off so it stays dark when I'm trying to sleep.

I always buy box fans so this was my first tower fan.  I really like that it can be used in a narrow space.  The oscillating feature makes a big difference and adds to the overall value.  I will buy tower fans in the future.

To prevent the electric bill from going way up in the summer, I use this fan to stay cool and it really works well! Very quiet on the first 3 settings, and impressive power on the 4th setting. My favorite is that it has a remote and oscillates.
IT WORKS GREAT BUT THE REMOTE DIED. Replaced the battery and still dead.
It all I think it works fine. However, if hot and need a fan cause your A/C went out Walmart wins for $26 blows this skinny blower out of the water.
It has very little power and span. Wouldn't buy again.  The old fashioned round fan I have is a thousand times more effective. Disappointed. And its not that quiet either.

I purchased 2 of these fans a year ago. Initially they were great but over time they have gotten weaker and weaker. Now, even at the highest setting they are not enough for hot days. Giving it 2 stars for the one season it worked well.

reviewTitle: Started making big noise after about 2 weeks of use.
reviewDescription: I would not recommend this item as after about 2 weeks the fans started making a lot of noise and had to return it.
Bought this fan because it had good reviews but it is not powerful at all, especially compared to a brand like Vornado. Really disappointed.
Product is nice, light but maybe I got a faulty device because it makes a loud noise every couple of minutes while on.

reviewTitle: Turns itself on and off and changes mode on it's own
reviewDescription: It worked good at first but after a month or 2 it started doing things on it's own.I like to have it set at 4 but it randomly turns down to 2 no matter what mode I have it in.
This fan is not quiet and unless you are in close proximity you can’t even feel the air circulation.

reviewTitle: Did not receive remote so do not know know if works but like size
reviewDescription: How do I get remote as one was not there been waiting for it to arrive
I've purchased Dreo products before. So far all have performed well.

reviewTitle: Timer can be tricky to operate
reviewDescription: I like the tall feature; seems to circulate the air better.
Works well. Takes up less space the a big box fan
Like this, operates quietly but wish it had more power

reviewTitle: Not as much air flow as advertised but its decent.
reviewDescription: It’s very quiet but not as powerful as advertised.
It works better than I thought.
Works great and worth the money
Good fan Blows well
Great fan for circulation

reviewTitle: Way better than a box fan
reviewDescription: Amazing blows cool air.

reviewTitle: Works, but doesn't put out much air
reviewDescription: I purchased this to use in our bedroom at night.  It works, but there is not a great deal of air that comes out.  It only has 4 speeds.  I keep it on maximum.  I am about 7 feel away from it and I don't feel much air coming out of it at all.  My spouse doesn't feel any air at all from it.  I know that this is not an air conditioner.  I am not expecting it to cool, but to have good air circulation.  It has plenty of room around it.  I keep it on a 180 degree rotation.  The remote is nice to have.  I don't find it to be very noisy at night.  However, my small fan that I have by the head of my bed which I am about 18" away from has much better air flow and does a better job of pushing air on us than this larger one.  I'm not very happy with this one.

I got this for my bedroom to help keep me cooler while sleeping.  It does that, however, it's quite loud.  It's kind of like white noise, so it's not too bad, but it could be quieter.  It was easy to put together, light to move, and has a remote.  The remote has a lot of buttons and is very dark, so hard to see at night to change settings.  I try to make sure it's how I want it before turning out the light or else I end up pushing the wrong buttons.  It keeps turning off at night even though I have not set the timer.  I would return it, but threw away the box and it's awkward to move.  Overall, it's okay, but I wouldn't purchase it again or recommend it.  I would try to find a quieter fan.

reviewTitle: not as quiet as people say it is
reviewDescription: pretty good tower fan. the air blows strong and well and I really like how the screen lights can turn off. that's ones of the reasons why I bought a new fan because when I would turn it on at the night the lights were too bring and I couldn't sleep but this has an option to turn off the lights completelywas looking for a fan that was pretty quiet, I can say I was impressed with how quiet it was one the first air flow mode. you can't hear that it's on at all (depending on how good your hearing is of course lol). but any other modes after like 2-4 you can still hear it running and it has no difference whether you use the mute mode or not. that I'm disappointed in and I had high expectations because some of the reviews I read said you couldn't hear anything at all. it's a little short, I'm 4'11 and it goes up to my chest, depending on the area you want to use it in you might need to prop it ontop of something.the installation was easy, all that was needed was go put together the bottom stand and thats it.I'd say it's pretty okay. im going to keep it however if it were up to anyone else I'd say just find something else for cheaper

It's pretty loud for a bedroom. The stand doesn't really stay level and is constantly leaning to one side or the other. The natural wind mode is just awful and if you're buying for that just don't. It starts to hum and make an annoying sounds loud enough to wake you up in the middle of the night leaving me to believe that after a few years it will be even louder so get the assurion warranty. IR remote is not the greatest. Other than those down sides it's easy to install and use the wind does feel nice and smooth one singular settings. I would still recommend it.

reviewTitle: Yes it is Quiet, but I would not call it much of a fan
reviewDescription: Yes, it is Quiet, but I would not call it much of a fan.  It needs to get a stronger motor or better blade to move the air.  It is not cheap, it is short, the openings of the fan is so low on the blade that you will want a box to put it on so it will be raised in the air.  If I did not need it, I would return it.  it is just a sad idea of a fan.  The remote and all of the controls are quite good, I am impressed.  I wish the device moved more air.

reviewTitle: Not exactly what I hoped for
reviewDescription: I bought this fan as a replacement for a 42" Lasko model I bought 2 years ago and that was accidentally broken. The reason I chose this Dreo model instead of another Lasko was because of these reviews, but after actually receiving it, I wish I had bought another Lasko instead.The first thing that is a downgrade is that this fan is several inches shorter, and yeah my fault for not noticing that in the fine print, but the result is I only feel the fan from about my stomach up when I'm sitting, which is not a problem I had with the other one. Another complaint is this thing makes a LOUD beep EVERY single time you plug it in, turn it on, turn it off, etc. Not a brief beep either, but a full second at least. One more thing that is worth mentioning, even if the fan is on speed 1, when you turn it on you will get this blast of full strength for a brief moment before the fans speed down. Not sure if that's just my unit but it's kind of annoying actually.With that said, I definitely regret buying this fan and wish I had bought another Lasko (T42951) instead.

reviewTitle: Good fan, but not the best for me
reviewDescription: I have a lot of trouble with fans. I need to have them around, but it’s hard for me to find the perfect fan. So many of them are too loud or make annoying background noises. And, you don’t get to know that until you’ve taken them out of the box and tried them.But I needed to get a new one. I wanted to trust what I saw with reviews for quiet, quality fans. This one seemed like one of the best. Reviews said it was quiet and it worked extremely well. It was priced higher than I wanted to pay, but I hoped it would be worth it for the improved quality and sound.So the verdict for me? It is indeed quiet, in that, the primary air it breathes isn’t loud on the lowest setting. But…the fan does make an annoying high-pitched whiny noise in the background. This is the very thing I hoped it would not have, and now I have paid a lot of money for a fan that is definitely not perfect for me. But, because of all that money, I don’t watch to ditch this fan just yet. I do feel I will be back at the drawing board in the near future.On the plus side, the fan does work well and has a nice variety of settings, more than other fans I’ve had, both for mode and speed. It uses a touchscreen-style format that doesn’t shine a light from the display constantly when it is on, which is another thing I like.Bottom line is that, it is an overall good fan, but I might not keep it for more than a year if I cannot get used to the whine. It would be a good fan for people who are either not bothered by or cannot hear the high-pitched sound.

reviewTitle: Not very powerful. Not truly quiet, but not loud at lower speeds.
reviewDescription: An ok fan for a small space just to move some air.  It is "relatively" quiet at lower speeds, but I would not call it quiet nor much quieter than any good large bladed fan.  I have not had to clean it yet, but hoping at least that feature is true to the marketing.  If you need a fan to really move air (like taking cool air from one large room to another as I do), you will want a more powerful fan.

The specs that are listed for this product are fraudelent, which makes it look like it'll keep you cool while being barely audible, but it's just what you would expect from a normal fan. For example, its lowest setting is totally ineffective, while being in the low 40s dB. The product's secondary features and remote are fine, which make it just worth not returning, but just get a normal cheap fan if you need one.

So I love the look of the fan and the sleekness. It also is touchscreen in addition to the remote. My only complaint is that I am honestly not that impressed with the air flow. On the highest setting of #4, it still feels like 50% air is blowing to me. And I have a very hot upstairs room. I wanted to find a fan that helps me avoid turning the window a/c unit on everyday. Unless there is something I am doing wrong, I am not sure how to feel about it yet. It would be great any other time of year, but for summer time I had hoped it would BLAST air. Almost makes me wish I had opted for a basic box fan. Just wanted something to look nicer and reviews led me to believe this was the one. Again, not the worst fan but for the cost…I should at least be able to see my hair blow in the wind😕

Got it a month ago. Worked fine for the first week, and then every other time I turned it on, it wouldn’t blow any air. Now it doesn’t even blow air at all. I checked it for obstacles and everything, but spending the money just for it to go down almost right when the return window ends is a real pain, especially as it’s hot in the summer
Poor quality. Stopped working 3 weeks after I got it. At first it would take a while to start when I turned it on, then just stopped working altogether.
Unless your using this in a room that’s already ice cold don’t expect to actually get comforting air out of it. Not impressed & I ordered 2.
Fan started cycling  up and down and just stopped working  less than a month of use.  Just past Amazon return window too. BIG Disappointment!

reviewTitle: Airflow strong then weak then strong
reviewDescription: Just got this & seems good and powerful then low power for 20 seconds then back to normal for a minute then loses power again. Not great!

reviewTitle: It will not work for long - WORST company ever
reviewDescription: Bought this fan last Summer, it worked for a few months, this Summer rolls around, I try to use it *a year to the day* after I’ve bought it and it stops working. No air blows out of it (it still oscillates though!) I contact the company, it takes weeks, I need to email them a video of the fan *not working*, they send me a replacement, tell me to throw out the old fan, and the replacement works for 2 days until it also stops blowing any air out of it. I’m now told to email yet another video of the “brand new replacement” once again not blowing air. Now because the replacement does not work, I am required to mail it back to the company - before I can receive a refund through PayPal - a company I do not use. And I’m without the fan in 90 degree heat. This is the worst customer service I’ve ever received. It’s the middle of summer, a month of a 20 e-mail long thread with this company and nothing gets resolved.

Stopped working within the first six hours of use.  Plus the base was impossible to remove, and with it attached it was impossible to fit in the original packaging, so I had to pay extra to UPS to have it returned

reviewTitle: Base set and other parts cannot be assembled.
reviewDescription: I spent almost an hour and still cannot assemble the simple base/bottom set because the parts were not cut or manufactured correctly, same as other parts too. I’m very disappointed to order this large item home and had to return it.
The item was incomplete no remote control in box. Fan not working properly without remote.Need a replacement or a remote control to work fan.

update: over a week later with no word back about the remote. that was the point of price, convenience. I should’ve spent $25 on a box fan at this rate.The fan itself is amazing, the power is great but also can be adjusted to really whatever mood you’re in. The ease of use and display is also nice and has a sleek design. In the end, one of the main reasons I chose this fan was the remote, that was non negotiable while picking a fan. I checked the box in and out but there was no remote :( I wrote customer service and have gotten no reply. May just have to return for one with remote.

I received my tower fan may 16 and in the beginning I absolutely loved how much air it pushed out. It’s only July 10th and it’s not blowing as much as it used to even on the highest setting and it keeps going in and out. The fan seems like it wants to give out which is ridiculous because I only had it for about 2 months. So irritated that I spent $60+ on this bull crap. I would like for it to be replaced but I know that’s not going to happen.

reviewTitle: Doesnt live up to all the hype.
reviewDescription: I read many reviews on fans before deciding on Dreo Tower Fan.  So many people have written glowing reviews on it, I figured this would be the answer to my Must-Have fan search.  Nope!I will start with what I like.  It is a nice looking fan.  It is quiet and doesnt take up as much space as other fans I have owned before.  I will even admit it does move some air.  The biggest problem with this fan is the amount of time it takes to complete the oscillation cycle.  13 seconds is WAY too slow.  The other fans I have in the house take about half that time.  If you want to set the fan to point direct at you and not cool the whole room, this fan would be do an excellent job.  It does move some air but when the rotation is so slow it isnt hitting me frequently enough.Its a good looking fan and it is pretty quiet but it doesnt do a great job of cooling down a room which would be priority number one for me.

reviewTitle: Barely blows air on the high setting
reviewDescription: I’m not impressed. I ordered two tower fans and they are not refreshing at all. The high setting is 4. The low settings feel like there’s no air blowing at all. Why is the high setting 4? Why not low med high ? I’m just not that pleased.

reviewTitle: The touchpad on fan is problematic
reviewDescription: While I was browsing Amazon to purchase a fan, I came across this fan which I purchased in 2022. So I thought let’s write a review.The touchpad on the fan is very problematic. I lost my remote somehow and I have to use the touchpad on fan to operate. After few months I had hard time operating this fan. And in another month the touchpad stopped completely and I have to throw it. I didn’t expect this from Dreo and I had no option to even return.

It worked well for a couple months after I bought it but sooner it started to just not give that fresh feel even when I have it up on full setting which is only 4. I clean it as it does get dusty but even if it's cleaned it Does Not give a good fresh feel. I would give this 1 star but I do like how it is touch screen and that it comes with a mini remote in order to get it started. It is easy to assemble but the negative thing about it is that it is Very wobbly and I've looked at the instructions exactly on how to fix the wobblyness and it Still is very wobbly.

reviewTitle: Stop calling this a cooling fan
reviewDescription: Ok let’s be honest if you are on TikTok and get TikTok shop ads you’ve seen this fan. People say this “blows cold air” and “makes the entire room cold” PLEASE. Please stop. It’s a regular tower fan that has a timer and a few basic settings. Does it work as a fan? Sure. It blows air. Is it any different than a regular tower fan you can buy at Walmart for half the price? Not really. Maybe you won’t get the nice remote control… but this isn’t anything special in my opinion. I was thinking I was getting a portable air conditioner the way people made this sound. I thought there would be a temperature control. Nope, regular fan :)

Really wanted to like this fan. Nice looking, very quiet and less bulky than my other tower fans. However, at it's highest setting it barely moves the air around. My traditional blade fans work much better than this unit. I bought this on sale along with the taller (9 speed) version. Sending them both back. Not worth the money as they have such weak airflow. Lasko High Velocity is the go to fan for me.

I bought this fan after reading reviews and thought I’d give it a try. It does not blow air as strong as I hoped. It’s in the middle of summer in Arizona averaging 110 degrees every day, I couldn’t feel the fan unless I sat next to it even on highest setting. I’m bummed that it didn’t work out, it seems good quality, just not suitable for where I live.

reviewTitle: Dont do it if you want an actual fan
reviewDescription: I really want to like this thing and I've had it for a while, but it just does not push air, like at all. Clean it, do whatever, it just does not provide what it says it does.

I bought this thinking it would help since my room gets super hot during the summer. This acts more like a Fan than a actual AC, so if you are looking for something that has short range and can only really help with a really small compact space this is for you. Otherwise take a look at ones with a longer range distance.

reviewTitle: Lifesaver in a Dorm Without Air Conditioning!
reviewDescription: I bought the Dreo Tower Fan for my son's dorm room, which unfortunately doesn't have air conditioning, and it's been an absolute lifesaver! The fan provides a powerful breeze that keeps the room cool, even in the sweltering heat. The oscillation feature keeps the air circulating evenly throughout the space, which is crucial in his small, stuffy dorm room.  One of the best features is how quiet it is. Despite the fan's power, my son can easily study or sleep without being disturbed by any noise, which is essential in a shared living environment. The fan is also sleek and compact, fitting perfectly in his room without taking up too much space. Overall, this fan has exceeded my expectations.  Highly recommended!

reviewTitle: 1 year later and I am so grateful to own this amazing fan!!
reviewDescription: I live in Southern California and the summers here can be pretty brutal. I live in a 1950s house that does not have proper insulation. So winters are very cold and summers are extremely hot. It just so happens that my room is the hottest room in the entire house. This fan has truly saved me from the summer heat. Every night during summertime, I set the timer for 4 to 5 hours at my desired level, and I have the best sleep ever. I really, really, really recommend this fan-It’s amazing! It will keep any room cool. It has four cooling levels, at first I was a little skeptical on whether that would be good enough for me, but the fourth level is actually pretty strong. I hardly ever use it at a four, I usually keep it at one or two and that’s perfectly fine for me. It has a wide range of swivel ability. It’s very easy to use. It is very light, not heavy at all. And my favorite of all, it’s very quiet. Lowest level is a very relaxing White Noise. Totally worth the price. Just buy it, you won’t regret it.

reviewTitle: So far I love it!  Nice looking, quiet, lots of speeds and a remote control ta boot!
reviewDescription: It has a little remote control I didn’t know I was going to get with it!  I am crippled so getting up and down to walk over to a fan to change the setting or turn it off is painful for me.  Now I have this nice little remote control that has lots of settings, not just an on and off button.  Even if it’s not hot in the room, sometimes I just get a hot flash or something.  So I just turn it on for half a minute and cool off.My husband hates the noise of our house A/C so I can’t leave it on for very long.  I don’t like the noise either but put up with it.  Not anymore though! Now I have this nice fan that isn’t noisy like my old fan was.  I’m really happy with it.  The oscillation setting is great when it’s just slightly hot in the room and a steady breeze is too much.

It works great and is easy to use. Might need a second person to help assemble it, but otherwise simple to put together with clear instructions. It keeps the room really cool and I love that there are several options for speed or setting a timer.The swaying option also works great, even though it’s a little bit too slow for my tastes. But in general, it’s fine. It’s also not that heavy and easy to move around the room wherever I need it.The settings on the screen can be controlled with the remote or directly by touching it. It’s a pretty bright screen too and goes dark after a minute or 5 seconds on night mode. (Which will gradually decrease speed every 30 mins. Took me forever to realize that lol)Nice, modern and sleek design and works amazingly. I love this thing, highly recommend!

I was overheating at night, and I bought this fan. I aimed it right at my upper torso in my bed, and set it on 3 all night. It's quieter than a standard fan, because you can't hear that rotating motor, but you do hear the wind. Not a problem for me, it's basically white noise so my brain kind of tunes it out. I woke up the next mornings not having sweat! I was so happy. Finally I was comfortable. Yay! Great fan!

reviewTitle: Best tower fan I’ve ever had
reviewDescription: I’ve been one of those people who always needs a fan around them for about 30 years and in that time I’ve been through a number of tower fans. This one is the best of the best. The four speeds and the remote are the things that set it above and beyond for me. Fan setting 4 is pretty powerful. This is a great fan for sleeping, relaxing, everything.

We spend most of our time in our den, a converted patio made into a room. While there is a large opening from the house area, it doesn't have an A/C vent directly into it. Still, it's pretty cool for us. Not our married kids if they have to sleep down there. So we bought this to blow directly on them or to sweep air to cool them while sleeping. They really like it, said it kept them cool to sleep. Now for further reference, both of them keep their home A/Cs in the 68 range and have ceiling fans on at night.

reviewTitle: It's pretty strong for its size
reviewDescription: I was pleasantly surprised when I learned how strong it was. It has four different speed settings, it rotates, and it comes with a timer which helps conserve the electricity and if you fall asleep before turning it off. It's great for those who need a fan on to sleep simply because of the timer. It's worth the price, light to move around an apartment or house, and the air fills up an average-sized room.

I love this fan. It seems to be of great quality for the price, and it's very easy to use. It's pretty stable, I don't have to worry about it falling over, even on carpet. It's lightweight and portable, easy to move around. The screen stays off unless you're pushing buttons, so I don't have to worry about it being too bright at night. And you can mute the beeping noise so it's silent when you change the speed and stuff. Also, when it's on speeds 1 and 2, you can't hear it at all...and speeds 3 and 4 aren't too loud for me...but i love the sound of a fan at night. Overall, I'm very satisfied with this tower fan.

I live in a railroad apartment, and both my A/C couldn’t keep it cool due to the lay out but let me tell you in how adding these fans really did the trick. I instantly fell in love and just the fans alone do a good job at keeping the area cool. My cat loves it! My dog loves it but my baby tries to fight the fan so be careful I guess babies have beef with fans. My wife even order 1 more! Idk she’s going mad. But great product and honestly it gets the 100% gold star. Yayyy!! No seriously dead to everything it’s good B.

I bought two of these fans and within one week, both of them began to randomly cycle between fan speeds. The first one I noticed as I was falling asleep because about every one second I could hear a significant change in the decibel level of the airflow. I turned the display on and saw that it was cycling between fan speeds 3 and 4. A few days later, the second unit started doing the same thing.

reviewTitle: Weird annoying noise, not worth the price
reviewDescription: I really wanted to like this fan it blows pretty good air on the highest level, but if you go down to 1 or 2 , you can hear that weird annoying noise that's in the video and it really barely blows any air at all unless on 3 or 4... for the price I think I could just buy a box fan and get better sound and air flow...going to return this noisy thing

reviewTitle: "Sleep Mode" is the worst creation I've ever seen in my life.
reviewDescription: The screen of this fan is extremely bright, and the only way to turn the screen off is with "sleep mode", however this mode is so horribly thought out and designed because how it works is that it will ignore whatever you set the fan as and instead lower the fan level all the way down to 1 over the course of about 1 hour. It's incredibly stupid, why would anyone want that? And that's the only way to get the extremely bright screen to turn off. Makes the fan practically unusable really. Which is a shame because it's a fantastic fan. Definitely buy anything else though.

This fan is very poorly made. It is poor quality plastic.1. Is wobbles and is easily knocked over2. I purchased the white color:  -the timer is difficult to read and to see  -every time you go to press a button the unit shakes and you have to repress.Very unsatisfactory

I came across this tower fan on Instagram and TikTok, where it seemed to be the latest trend. Influencers praised its ability to cool a room quickly and efficiently, so I decided to give it a try. Unfortunately, my experience was far from what I expected.Firstly, the fan is quite loud. Instead of the gentle hum I anticipated, it produces a noticeable noise that can be quite distracting. Additionally, despite the hype, the fan's cooling power is disappointingly weak. It struggles to make a significant difference in room temperature, making it a poor choice for those seeking effective cooling.I would recommend exploring other options. Save yourself the hassle and avoid the need for a return by choosing a more reliable fan.

I just now turned it on for the first time and oscillate doesn’t work. I’ve double checked the base is installed correctly. It’s too big to mess around with returning it so I’m just out the money.After leaving it running overnight, I now see it is barely blowing any air at all. And yes I’ve checked that it’s on the right setting. It’s set on 4, and on the setting where it should be blowing on full all the time.This is junk and I’ll be throwing it away.

This fan is incredibly noisy. Not in the way where it’s just the fan blowing it sounds like parts of the plastic are vibrating within the fan. What’s worse is it’s not even a consistent tone which makes it absolutely impossible to fall asleep to. 100% wasted my money on this.

I TURNED ON THE FAN AND IT WORKED PERFECTLY THE FIRST TIME AND WHEN I TURNED IT OFF AND THEN BACK ON AGAIN THE FAN NO LONGER WAS BLOWING OUT AIR HOWEVER, THE OTHER FEATURES TO THE FAN WORKED FINE.  I ALSO MUST NOTE THAT I PURCHASE TWO OF THE FANS AND THE EXACT PROBLEM OCCURRED.  THE FANS STOPPED BLOWING OUT AIR AND EVERYTHING ELSE WORKED.

Shortly after assembling the fan it stopped working so I cannot recommend this product and would add buyer beware as the cost of returning the item far exceeds the purchase cost. Amazon insisted I return the broken fan - in my case from half way round the world - initially at my cost with the promise of a refund. Not happy with this product to say the least!

Started making a loud squeaking noise after a few weeks of use. The noise just randomly comes and goes. Sounds terrible. Unfortunately don't think I can return it at this point. Beware. Also, the cord is very short. It's annoying when trying to move around room or get a specific angle. When it's not making a weird loud squeaking noise it's not bad though.

It works ok it’s quite if that helps but if you live in a tropical climate like Hawaii it’s not worth it.  I got it cause people in Florida was raving about it but I think they may use it with air conditioner. Here in Hawaii electricity is so expensive we don’t combine it so if just a fan it’s ok.

Recently moved into my first apartment and desperately needed ac / fan on a budget so I figured I would give this a shot. It’s pretty quiet and I like that it has a mute setting & doesn’t have a light that’s constantly on. Doesn’t really cool a room down but it’s a nice quiet fan.

I purchased this fan because of most of the reviews. I should have paid attention to the 3 and 4 star reviews. I’m in NY, and this summer - July 2024. - has been a scorcher.PROS:  It’s quiet, especially on the lower speeds. Be careful, you might leave it on and forget it.  It has an energy-saving mode.  It’s easy to assemble and it’s sturdy.  It comes with a remote.CONS: This fan is only good for temps below 85F, not for anything above that, especially the 90s. It’s also  only good if you’re sitting right in front of it, the rest of the room, oh well, you better make it  oscillate and follow it.  The features on the remote are not visible at night in a dark room.

reviewTitle: 4 speed settings. Doesn't blow air as well as other fans.
reviewDescription: Best use on a stool so you can feel air.4 speed setting. Timer. 4 different modes.Best thing light turns off on screen after a few secs no matter what setting.  It blow cold air when the surrounding air is cold other then that can use a box fan and get same air.

I bought this for a small room 12 X12 as it had good reviews for a strong air flow.  If you're standing directly in front of it it will blow your hair back a bit but you can't feel it across the room.  It is quiet enough leave it on while sleeping.
The fan is a lot shorter than I expected. The remote control is great, but if you want to push the buttons on the fan itself it's a little tricky because they are digital buttons and not raised.

reviewTitle: Not the strongest fan of high heat
reviewDescription: I was hoping to love this product but honestly it isn’t as strong as people were making it seem. It’s good a for a little bit of heat but honestly it just isn’t that strong

This needs to be a sale item. There's a heatwave going on and my AC died.  I have two other fans going on. One fan I purchased 4 years ago for not more than $50. It's wobbly but it produces noticeable comfort. The other fan was delivered 2 weeks ago for about $150 and it's a high performer but there's a lot of space to cover. So I bought this fan for about $70 and the maximum level is 4. It's a low performer; no help at all. Probably good for a small bedroom. I'd return it, but I'm tired of returning items. What's wrong with manufacturers today? Please produce quality product!
Fans speed at highest not that strong and moves slow on spin and rocks.  Tower not sturdy.  I was bummed.  Opened after I could return it
I'm not impressed by these fans. I bought 2 and am disappointed to say the least.  They don't blow cold air and the quality isn't great.

I have had this fan for about 7 months now, and overall, it is fine. Good airflow, nice features and I like the remote. However, at low speeds it has a buzz. The noise comes from the plastic housing, not the motor. If you walk up to the fan and touch it the noise stops. I'll reposition it to try to stop the buzz and a few seconds after I walk away, it starts again. On level 2, the buzz is less noticeable, but I don't always need that much airflow. The noise comes in and out when I put it on oscillate. This was not enough of an issue for me to go through the trouble of returning it, especially since the fan I replaced was even louder than this but I am not sure I would buy this brand again. It could just be the one I got. Just something to keep in mind

I can't believe how many people rate this fan with high reviews. It has four air flow levels and on level 4 barely puts out. The only thing good about tower fans is that it doesn't take as much floor space.  Just buy your standard Lasko or Amazon brand fans and you will be happier

so far, this fan is keeping my bedroom cool.The quiet sleep mode is really quiet. You can't even hear that the fan is running.light weight fan so, try your best not to tip it over.I place my tower fans off the ground so, the breeze will come from a height.

Kind of disappointing. The strength of the breeze is  not great. Timer is useful some of the optional settings confuse me. But it's a fan, I don't necessarily want to refer to a Manual to figure out what the symbols on the controls mean. Glad I bought it on sale.
Does not put off a good amount of air. I understand that this isn’t a high power fan but 2 feet away and you can barely feel it blowing air. Setting is as high as it will go
It is light and quiet as others highlighted but the plastic looks cheap and light and it smells like plastic when the fan is sitting there or it is on. Don't recommend.
very quiet but not very powerful. when on 4 (high) is a about a medium speed- not nearly as powerful as I hoped . won't return, but would not purchase again
I love the look of it but I wish I would have know the power on 4 isn’t very powerful so I would have gotten the higher speed one
Very disappointed. Definitely does not cover the whole room (not even half) in my small studio apartment. I would return it if it weren't such a hastle.
Easy packing, easy set up, minimal noise. However the power is not as strong as I would expect for the price I pay.

reviewTitle: Great performance of the fan, but does NOT work with Alexa as shown in the video
reviewDescription: The Dreo Tower Fan for Bedroom impresses with powerful wind speed that effectively covers an average-sized room (12'). Assembly is straightforward, complemented by an intuitive remote control for ease of use. However, its overly intricate packaging, featuring excessive plastic and numerous ties, detracts from the unboxing experience. Despite claims on its Amazon page, the fan disappoints by not integrating with Alexa, which is advertised in a misleading video. Other models offer similar features without such discrepancies and at better pricing. Ultimately, the Dreo Tower Fan is a solid choice for cooling, marred only by the unmet expectation of smart home integration, warranting a three-star rating.

I purchased this fan for my bedroom and I’m disappointed with the results. It does not blow powerful at all! I place it about 5 feet from my bed on a step and I can barely feel it. Also, the fact that you can’t adjust where the air blows is no good. The cord is also on the shorter side. It is sleek and easy to assemble and runs fairly quiet but that’s as good as it gets. I have an older Lasko brand fan and it’s way more powerful on level 1 (minimum) than this Dreo is on level 4 (max)- see video for comparison. I will be returning this and purchasing another Lasko fan.
this fan started out great but, then started to die out. hardly any air flow and must be in front to feel anything.

Honestly….im not really a fan. Since I first bought…like 2 days ago. Everytime I set the setting to 4…..it ends up going down to 1 over a short time span. I notice it a lot when I’m sleeping bc I end up waking up with the sweats thinking that I put the fan on. And I DID put the fan on but it decided on its own to lower the setting. I’ve tried different settings to see what’s causing the problem but it still goes down. The time would also be on 0. So I set the timer at 8 hours thinking it’ll stay on 4, but no, it still lowered to 1 after like an hour. It is very troubling. I live in Vegas and the 1st setting just isn’t as strong as the 4th…of course. And so when I put it on 4….it should STAY on 4. But it does not. Also the sound, sounds like a normal fan to me. I wouldn’t say that it’s quiet. And I do wish there was a higher and more powerful setting than 4.
Fuctions well but nothing special for the price.  Easy to use & somewhat of a space saver but better deals can be had.

The fan works amazing and I love it, BUT…be careful that it never gets accidentally knocked over. Mine did 1 time and now I have to play with it every time to get it to even stand up. There’s no way for it to be fixed, the base is just cheap plastic. Sometimes it’s running and standing upright and when I turn it off it just falls right over. Other times I can’t get it to stand upright at all and have to lean it against something.
It was great... for 6 months. Now it makes a loud ticking noise on any of the speeds
Worked great for a little over a year.An $80 fan should last a bit longer.

For the price, you think you would get more than a foot of air coming out of a vent that’s about 3ft long. I have to elevate it on a box so when I’m in my bed, the air flow reaches me. If not, it only hits my mattress. Now I have to worry if it will fall and break. Very deceiving. I’m very bummed. The airflow is good though, but only from that small part of the vent.

I like it. It looks nice. The first one arrived with the cord spliced in half despite the nice safe packaging and double boxing. But they picked it right up and shipped a replacement quickly so I can’t complain with that. But now I feel like it’s lowering the power by itself. I’ll have it on 3 then it goes down to 2 then 1. Kinda need it on a 3 right now you know what I mean

reviewTitle: Flimsy Base & Not Very Powerful Even At Highest Speed
reviewDescription: I would NOT recommend nor would I repurchase this fan  . . .  Let me start by saying that I have always purchased my tower fans at Costco which have been great fans . . . solid bases & their high speed was a high speed . . . but this time I had to purchase a fan from Amazon & this fan just wasn't up to par with the fans I have purchased at Costco . . . First, the highest speed wasn't high at all & the base was so flimsy, that it fell over once & the base broke off from the fan & wasn't able to b put back together . . . I had such high hopes for this fan but turned out I only was able to use it for about 3 months . . . it was very disappointing . . . just one person's opinion on this fan . . .
So I've been seeing all these commercials and videos for this particular fan. It doesn't blow cool air at all. I love how quiet it is but it's not giving what I thought
The fan works great but the remote is not in the box. Other than that the fan is really nice and works for what we need it for
I think in theory I wanted to believe it was going to be better since the design was sleek but I think it is a basic fan. Easy to use and definitely love the remote for its convenience.
The picture depicts cold air blowing . But in reality it’s cool air. The room doesn’t get cold. It’s not bad but it’s not it.
Purchased in January and it was great! Now it’s May and getting hot and it’s not nearly as strong as it was.
It rattles. It’s not quiet at all. The remote is nice, it’s easy to use. Has a lot of power. Not quiet.

reviewTitle: Doesn’t blow colder air. Just a normal fan
reviewDescription: Other reviews made it seem like this was a cold air blowing fan, but it’s just a normal fan!
Difficult to attach tower to fan alone. Domedctooborevents easy assemble
Max wind power is not impressive. Cool modern design tho.

It's a fan. It blows air. It does It's intended job.... however... It's not loud. Even on the highest setting i can barely hear it. I have it in my bedroom, which is far smaller than the recommended coverage area, and I can't tell a difference unless I'm standing directly in front of the fan. I purchased based on the reviews of it being loud and cooling down a room....very disappointed.

The fan works fine Good air flow and all that. And I use it by the bedside so the remote control is always there on the table. But without the remote control,not so much. All of the button controls or front-facing so you would have to bend down to visually see which button you want to push versus other models that have the controls on top of the fan.

With 75% of this fan blowing below the mattress, you have to have the fan on high which is very noisy to get any air at all. I rated this as a three instead of one because there might be some applications and some people may not use this in the bedroom, maybe it works in the living room or somewhere else but absolutely not in the bedroom
My fan makes an awful squeaky sounds when I use the oscillating option.  So therefore I don't use that option.  It's disappointing. Otherwise, it's quite and satisfying.

reviewTitle: I love it! Bug came damaged? Some concerns on delivery.
reviewDescription: I'm really happy with it. it was easy to set up, quiet and much smoother of a sound than my standard fan - which this is replacing. My room is small so I needed something that took up less space and I didn't hit with my hips on the way out.Great settings, quiet oscillation(EDIT: Semi-quiet - the cheap base creaks as it turns), and overall I like the features it offers. It has a slot in the back that holds your remote, but I find that is pointless if you want to control it from where you are. Good for storage when away, though.There are some cons, though, that I noticed right out of the box:Cheap base: It's easy to tumble this thing if you hit it. After assembly I noticed it's a little shaky on the base - definitely not solid, which makes sense since it's plastic. I was carrying my old fan out of my room after setup and hit it - it immediately went down. Thankfully caught it before it could hit the ground, but that's where I noticed the next issue:Damage: Not sure if this happened in the box or some time when I set it on my bed  - I could not find the missing piece anywhere - but there is a hole on the top? Does not look part of manufacturing and the manual doesn't mention it. I'm assuming it's damage from the factory. Bit of a bummer to get a damaged product considering the very first issue I had with this purchase -Shipping: I ordered this two weeks or so ago. It got delayed and eventually just didn't show up, so I requested a refund. Got it, thankfully, and when I ordered it again it arrived just fine. Not sure what the hold up was with the first order . . .just something to note if you order this. Their distributor may have shenanigans going on.So overall because I had some issues just getting this to my house I knocked some stars off - but overall I do like it and hope it lasts.
